At Modivcare, we embody a Culture of Care.
  
  

We are children and grandchildren serving parents and grandparents.
  
  

**We live and lead by our Values:**  

We treat everyone with dignity and RESPECT
  
  

We earn the TRUST of our members and each other
  
  

We provide RELIABLE services that open doors
  
  

We serve with courtesy and COMPASSION
  
  

We prioritize SAFETY
  
  

We communicate with purpose and TRANSPARENCY
  
  

This position is responsible for providing professional, non-clinical personal care and caregiving services to enable clients to remain healthy and independent in their home and community settings. You will assist with instrumental activities of daily living while encouraging self-care and independence.
  
  

**Essential Job Functions:**  

* Desire to contribute to the well-being and quality of life of our clients
* Competent in providing direct care to clients, including:
* Bathing/grooming/dressing/toileting
* Personal hygiene improvement & maintenance
* Transferring/ambulation assistance
* Medication reminders
* Maintains a clean, comfortable, and safe living environment
* Transportation, as requested/approved
* Meal preparation
* Housekeeping & Laundry
* Grocery Shopping
* Supports completion of activities of daily living
* Ability to contribute to a client's quality of life by influencing:
* Patient Safety
* Good hygiene
* Healthy eating
* Medication adherence
* Clean home environments
* Happiness
* Decreased social isolation via companionship
* Improved mental health via engaging in daily activities
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability to work independently
* Ability to identify and escalate unsafe or inappropriate home and community conditions
* Ability to escalate life-threatening emergency situations calmly and appropriately
* Ability to navigate diverse client personalities and behaviors
* Comfort working in and respecting diverse work environments in client homes

En Modivcare, incorporamos una Cultura de Cuidado. Somos hijos y nietos al servicio de padres y abuelos.

Tratamos a todos con dignidad y RESPETO
  
  

Nos ganamos la CONFIANZA de nuestros miembros y entre nosotros

Servimos con cortesía y COMPASIÓN
  
  

Priorizamos la SEGURIDAD
  
  

Comunicamos con sentido y TRANSPARENCIA
  
  

Este puesto es responsable de brindar atención personal profesional y no clínica y servicios de atención para permitir que los clientes se mantengan saludables e independientes en su hogar y entorno comunitario. Ayudará con actividades instrumentales de la vida diaria mientras fomenta el autocuidado y la independencia.
  
  

**Funciones Laborales Esenciales:**  

* Deseo de contribuir al bienestar y calidad de vida de nuestros clientes
* Competente en la prestación de atención directa a los clientes, incluyendo:
* Bañarse/asearse/vestirse/ir al baño
* Mejora y mantenimiento de la higiene personal
* Asistencia en traslado/deambulación
* Recordatorios de medicamentos
* Mantiene un ambiente de vida limpio, cómodo y seguro
* Transporte, según lo solicitado/aprobado
* Preparación de comidas
* Servicio de limpieza y lavandería
* Compras
* Apoya la realización de las actividades de la vida diaria
* Capacidad para contribuir a la calidad de vida de un cliente influyendo en:
* Seguridad del paciente
* Buena higiene
* Alimentación saludable
* Adherencia a la medicación
* Entornos domésticos limpios
* Disminución del aislamiento social a través de la compañía
* Mejora de la salud mental a través de la participación en actividades diarias
* Excelentes habilidades de comunicación
* Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente
* Capacidad para identificar y escalar condiciones inseguras o inapropiadas en el hogar y la comunidad
* Capacidad para escalar situaciones de emergencia que amenazan la vida de manera tranquila y apropiada
* Capacidad para navegar por diversas personalidades y comportamientos de los clientes
* Comodidad al trabajar y respetar los diversos entornos de trabajo en los hogares de los clientes

Referral Bonuses are also available!
  
  

Concern Housing is seeking a Weekend Evening Counselor who will be responsible for assisting the Service Coordinator in the delivery of direct services to the clients, as well assisting in the overall running of the site. The counselor provides a variety of services, ranging form the teaching of skills to delivery of concrete services to providing counseling to the clients.

Provides direct care services to clients.

title: Per Diem Facilities Custodian
description:
Concern Housing is seeking a Per Diem Facilities Custodian to be responsible for the routine, general cleaning of the building and cleaning of the individual apartments in the building.
  
  

**Position:** Per Diem Facilities Custodian
  
**Location:** Bronx, NY
  
**Schedule:** Per diem - as needed basis
  
**Salary:** $16.00/hr.
  
  

**Duties and Responsibilities:**  

Vacuum offices, hallways, stairs, lobby, lounge area, exercise room, conference room and all other common areas
  
  

Dust all office furniture, windowsills, countertops, etc.
  
  

Empty office, bathroom, lounge, exercise room, conference room and all other common area wastebaskets
  
  

Clean bathroom fixtures, counters, mirrors, and mop floors
  
  

Assure adequate supplies are in bathrooms
  
  

Clean building floors by sweeping, mopping, scrubbing, or vacuuming them
  
  

Maintain adequate stock of all custodial supplies, ordering additional as needed
  
  

Follow procedures for the use of chemical cleaners
  
  

Notify managers concerning the need for major repairs
  
  

Remove snow from sidewalks, driveways, and parking areas, using snowplows, snow blowers, and snow shovels, and spread snow melting chemicals
  
  

Maintaining the cleanliness of the exterior of the building including removing debris from the property, sweeping patios and walkways as needed
  
  

Set up, arrange, and remove decorations, tables, chairs, and ladders to prepare facility for events such as banquets and meetings
  
  

Spray insecticides and fumigants to prevent insect and rodent infestation as allowed by law and with proper protection
  
  

Dust, clean and maintain exercise equipment

Wearing proper Personal Protective Equipment at all times

Assist Maintenance Mechanic and/or Superintendent when needed

Wash inside and outside of all windows, as assigned
  
  

Wash off marks on walls and doors
  
  

Dust door ledges and floor boards
  
  

Dust chair/furniture legs
  
  

Scrub bathroom floor, walls, and fixtures
  
  

Clean and/or shampoo carpeting and upholstery
  
  

Coordinate moving or set up of furniture to individual units
  
  

May be required to assist with the clean up of areas damaged by residents

Good communication and interpersonal skills, client/customer service skills and ability to follow oral and written instructions. Must have the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and work effectively with a team. Must have basic knowledge of cleaning products. The work requires routine walking, standing, bending and carrying items weighing less than fifty pounds and moving items over fifty pounds utilizes a team lift.

title: Quality Improvement Coordinator
description:
Concern Housing is seeking a Quality Improvement Coordinator to participate in the overall execution of Quality Improvement and Compliance Department activities; including but not limited to audit activities, incident management, program support and policy and procedure implementation and administrative follow up. This individual will also participate in Admission activities, including intakes. Must be willing to travel between NYC and Long Island, as needed.  

  

Position: Quality Improvement Coordinator  

Location: Long Island & NYC Based  

Schedule: Monday - Friday; 9am - 5pm  

Salary: $60-80k/yr.  

  

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:  

  

* Incident Management tracking activities and administrative follow up, including, but not limited to coordinating


meetings, taking minutes, completing NIMRS reports, completing Precision Care Incident reports, completing quarterly  

and annual trend reports, incident follow up and tracking/gathering supporting documentation.  

  

* Conduct incident investigations and post mortem reviews, as assigned and complete related follow up.

  

* Develop expertise in Electronic Health Records system, support and facilitate agency internal Precision Care Help Desk


and provide troubleshooting and technical support as needed.  

  

* Complete administrative follow up and track all problems to ensure resolution of issues.

  

* Provide administrative support to the Risk Management Committee including, but not limited to, coordinating meetings,


taking minutes and completing necessary follow up.  

  

* Provide administrative support to the Quality Improvement Committee and various Sub-Committees including, but not


limited to, coordinating meetings, taking minutes and completing necessary follow up.  

  

* Take lead with Records Management activities, included but not limited to filing overflow and discharged records for LI


SHO and CR/CTAP programs; coordinating destruction of records which have reached retention across all departments  

and programs; maintaining retention and destruction logs and updating Concern’s Records Retention Schedule.  

  

* Participate in auditing activities, as assigned and assist with coordinating and/or facilitating administrative follow up.

  

* Maintain all Compliance/QI tracking systems to include the Compliance, Accounting of Disclosures, (including all video footage and record requests), Grievance, Gift and Incident logs, and track and document all issues through resolution.

  

* Maintain and Update Compliance/QI Work Plan and Internal Auditing Schedule

  

* Participate in troubleshooting and administrative support activities for various software databases including RHIO and


OMH database systems and provide training and support for the correct use of these systems including use of electronic  

devices, i.e., iPads.  

  

* Maintain Policies/Procedures and Forms Directories and participate in regular review of creating and updating forms and policies. Provide training to support implementation.

  

* Provide training and support to program staff in response to individual and/or program needs.

  

* Produce reports regularly and as assigned, to support programs and to assist in keeping senior management informed of


trends and outcomes.  

  

* Participate in internal agency and external committees.

  

* Remain current with all agency required compliance documents and trainings.

  

* Other duties as assigned.

  

Requirements: NOTE: This position includes travel to Long Island and NYC programs, as needed. Agency vehicles may be used for travel, as available.  

  

Bachelor’s Degree Required, Master’s Degree preferred plus a minimum of three years of relevant management experience in residential programs. Previous Residential Director experience preferred. Candidate should have knowledge of state and federal regulations and have excellent communication skills. Candidate should possess leadership qualities and be able to follow through on tasks independently. The individual should also possess skills in group facilitation, employee training, creating and/or revising policies. Knowledge and experience in Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Power Point, Precision Care and general Information Technology is strongly preferred.  

  

Click here to apply: https://www.appone.com/MainInfoReq.asp?R\\_ID=6188813

title: Housing Compliance Specialist
company: West Harlem Group Assistance, Inc.-Community for Healthy Food Program
description:
Processes all re-certification, prepare various reports**,** review commercial and tenant files, and attend meetings. Must be familiar with all tax credit compliance requirements for Properties in the Tri-State area.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Coordinates annual re-certification process
* Creates all annual reporting documents for syndicators and government agencies
* Corrects all (if any) 8823’s
* Completes yearly audit of Tax Credit tenants files to ensure full compliance
* Implements all compliance procedures and regulations
* Keeps informed of tax credit regulations and changing policies - Advise Rental Housing Staff on updated compliance procedures and regulatory requirements
* Works closely with Director of Compliance on Tax Credit and compliance issues
* Income qualify applicants for initial move-in and prepare move-in documents for Property Managers

**LEASE AND RENT-UP (COMMERCIAL AND RESIDENTIAL)**

* Reviews rent rolls/Yardi lease expiration reports to determine if leases were completed prior to the expiration date
* Reviews tenant files/Yardi lease expiration reports to determine if lease renewal notices were sent to tenants accordingly
* Prepares & expedites all annual lease renewals for all tenants - Send lease renewal notices 120/90/60/30 days in advance with applicable rent increase.
* Signs all documents with resident prior to lease/re-certification expiration
* Once lease renewals are received back in our office, prepare proper documentation so the lease will be renewed in Yardi. Also ensure additional security deposit amounts are requested from tenants who are renewing their annual lease renewals.
* Ensures all section 8 tenants lease renewals are prepared and sent to Section 8 and received back in a timely fashion.
* Enters new resident information into Yardi Software and create new resident files.
* Maintain neat and organized files, storage, and work space

**SPECIAL PROJECTS:** 

* Assists in reviewing tenants’ files to ensure files are organize/properly maintained.
* Assists Directors of Property Management in the audit of tenants files
* Reviews tax credits documentation for the preparation and rental of vacant units
* Completes projects as assigned by Upper Management

***EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:***

* Must possess LIHTC-Affordable Housing Compliance Certification LIHTC/HUD/HOME
* Must be familiar with all tax credit compliance requirements for Properties in the Tri-State area.
* High school graduate, some college preferred.
* 2-3 years relevant LIHTC experience
* Knowledge of Yardi
* Bilingual a plus

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $35.66 per hour

Expected hours: 35 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

* Possess LIHTC-Affordable Housing Compliance Certification LIHTC/HUD/HOME

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* LIHTC: 2 years (Required)

title: Employment Coordinator
description:
Concern Housing offers a generous benefit package which includes; Medical Insurance (Agency pays 80% of the premium), Affordable Voluntary Dental and Vision Insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts, Agency Sponsored Retirement Plan, Employee Sponsored 403(b) Retirement Plan, Agency Sponsored Life Insurance Coverage and an Excellent Paid Time Off Package. Concern encourages employee growth, offering Educational Assistance and Scholarship Programs, Licensure Reimbursement and Possible Internship/Clinical Supervision. Referral Bonuses are also available!
  
  

Concern Housing is seeking an Employment Coordinator to assist clients in obtaining and maintaining employment consistent with their identified vocational goals and recovery. The Employment Coordinator engages clients and establishes trusting, collaborative relationships directed toward the goal of competitive employment in integrated job settings. The Employment Coordinator also acts as a resource for ongoing benefits advisement as related to any impact employment may have on entitlements.
  
  

**Position:** Employment Coordinator
  
**Location:** Ronkonkoma, NY
  
**Schedule:** Monday-Friday; 9am-5pm
  
**Salary:** $49,000/yr.
  
  

**Duties and Responsibilities:**  

Assess clients’ vocational functioning utilizing background information and work experiences.
  
  

Develop an individualized employment plan with clients, noting self-identified goals and interests.
  
  

Assist clients in job development and job search activities directed toward positions that are consistent with their employment plan.
  
  

Provide benefits advisement to allow clients to make informed choices regarding the range of benefits they receive, or those for which they may be eligible, and the impact of employment on entitlements.
  
  

Assist with resume building, interviewing skills, orientation to transportation, coping skills, and stress management as related to securing and maintaining employment.
  
  

Provide individualized, supportive services to assist clients in sustaining employment, including on-site job guidance/coaching.
  
  

Provide education and support to employers, as agreed upon by the client, which may include negotiating job accommodations and follow-up contacts with the employer.
  
  

Utilize outreach services to foster partnerships with other community organizations as related to supported employment opportunities.
  
  

Complete documentation requirements in Precision Care within 48 hours of client contact, according to agency policy.
  
  

Submit all reports and billable services to ACCES-VR timely.
  
  

Remain current with all Agency required compliance documents and trainings.
  
  

Other duties as assigned.
  
  

**Requirements:** Bachelor’s degree preferred in mental health or social services. At least 2 years of related experience in vocational services, including ACCES-VR.

title: LSW/LAC Clinician (Full-time, Hybrid, Flexible)
description:
Are you a recent grad looking for a unique opportunity that’s not your typical 9-5? If you're seeking flexibility, hands-on experience, and the chance to work both remotely and within your community, this could be the perfect fit for you!

At Savia Community Counseling Services, LLC, we're on a mission to create positive change in the lives of those we serve. Our strength-based approach to mental health services is designed to empower both our youth and families and our team members.

**Why Join Us?**

* **Flexibility:** Enjoy a full-time position with a mix of telehealth and in-person sessions, plus time for documentation and collateral calls.
* **Clinical Supervision:** Gain valuable supervision hours toward your license while learning from experienced professionals.
* **Impactful Work:** Make a real difference by providing therapeutic counseling to children and families.
* **Professional Growth:** Develop your skills in a supportive environment that’s dedicated to your career advancement.

**Responsibilities:**

* Dedicate 26 hours per week to face-to-face sessions (telehealth/in-person) with children and families.
* Allocate 14 hours per week for documentation, collateral calls, and other administrative tasks.
* Teach strategies to manage challenging behaviors, helping to build healthier family dynamics.
* Collaborate with Child-Family Teams (CFT) including behavioral assistants, mentors, care managers, and other community resources.
* Participate in supervision sessions to discuss and refine your therapeutic approach.
* Develop and implement personalized treatment plans.
* Maintain thorough documentation of your work, including progress notes and treatment plans.

\\*

**Requirements:**

* Valid New Jersey License (LSW, LAC, LMFT, LCSW, LPC).
* At least 1 year of experience working with children in the mental health field.
* Valid NJ Driver’s License.

**Benefits:**

* Clinical supervision hours.
* Medical, vision, and dental insurance.
* Short-term disability coverage.
* Paid time off
* Paid training days and holidays.
* Opportunities for professional development and career growth.

Join Savia Community Counseling Services, LLC, and start making a difference today!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Life insurance

License/Certification:

* LSW or LAC (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Luxury Manager
description:
**Now is the Time! Join our Team as a Luxury Manager!**

**Jared the Galleria of Jewelry is looking for YOU!**  
**Retail Reimagined.**...We are leading the industry and retail by meeting our customers where they are. Our **Path to Brilliance** is in full swing.

Our **Luxury Managers** are supporting their General and Assistant General Managers to deliver exceptional customer experience and sales results in store and virtually using our state of the art technology platforms and passion to succeed. It is the most exciting time to join **Jared** as we escalate our **Path to Brilliance** and lead the jewelry and retail industries as we **PIVOT** to excel our success forward.

Are you ready for a financially rewarding career you love where customer experience, team work and innovation will drive your success? Your passion combined with our state of the art technology and resources will launch your forever career.  
Apply to **Jared** if you are ready to **Pivot** to **Retail Reimagined**. 

**Luxury Manager:**  
Our Luxury Managers are helping us to redesign **Jared** while enjoying a 40hour work week and a financially rewarding career of celebrating life and expressing love with our customers. You will collaborate with the General and Assistant General Manager in developing exceptional teams, driving sales and profit excellence, and innovation to inspire your team to succeed in store and virtually.

We value **integrity**, **diversity**, **teamwork**, **innovation, agility and technical knowledge**. We offer **opportunities for advancement** and **financial rewards for success**. We provide training on coaching, in store and virtual sales techniques, technology, product knowledge and skills to take your career to the next level. In return, we ask that you bring your commitment to sales and profit excellence, desire to grow, agility and ability to deliver an exceptional customer and team member experience.

**Basic Function:**  
The Luxury Manager is a supporting management position within Jared. This position will achieve store and individual sales on all platforms by providing exceptional customer experience and expert product knowledge. This position will be responsible for overseeing merchandise launch executions, implementing product education provided by Signet, assists in training and developing the team in your area of expertise.  
**Responsibilities** include the following and will continue to evolve with our **Path to Brilliance**. Additional responsibilities will be discussed during your interview and upon hiring.

* Consistently attains sales results on all platforms while delivering an exceptional customer and team member experience.
* Build customer relationships through outreach and follow up using our clientele system and a variety of platforms and assists with training team members to do the same.
* Maintains our daily health and safety protocols including cleaning and sanitizing to ensure the safety of our customers and team.
* Completes all assigned training.
* Provides expert product knowledge training and implements visual merchandise displays according to company guidelines.
* Manages the team and store in the General Manager and Assistant General Manager’s absence. Supports and implements all policies.
* Collaborates with the General and Assistant General Manager on recruiting, hiring, scheduling, performance management and training of the team.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Required Skills and Abilities include:**

* Ability to lead by example by delivering sales and performance results daily and at Special Events.
* Positive, enthusiastic, team-spirited work style.
* Ability to innovate and collaborate within in a team environment.
* Ability to train and develop Team Members, conduct Store training meetings as needed.
* Professional approach and image.
* Tactful, friendly manner when dealing with people.
* Ability to plan, organize, follow-up and supervise the work of others.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including phone etiquette.
* Ability to accept responsibility, make decisions, delegate, and follow-up as appropriate.
* Reliable and dependable.

**A Sampling of Our Total Rewards:**  
\\*\\*  
Base pay plus commission on sales  
Benefits including medical, dental, vision and prescription insurance (full-time team members)  
401(k)  
Paid vacation  
Paid holidays (full-time team members)  
Tuition reimbursement, including DCA courses based on position  
Training   
Career development   
Merchandise discounts

Signet Jewelers is an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting diversity of all levels of employees. Please know that while we appreciate every applicant's interest, we can only contact those selected for further consideration.  
Signet maintains an online registry system to encourage all interested employees to apply for careers in the management positions listed in this registry, and to ensure equal opportunities for advancement to all Signet employees. We particularly encourage women and minorities who are interested in management opportunities at Signet to participate in this program and use this online registry system to express your interest in a management position. Registration in this online system does not guarantee a promotion, but is necessary for consideration for any promotional opportunity to a management position listed in this registry.

Location: 1500 Bergen Town Center, Paramus, New Jersey 07652

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $21.00 per hour

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift

Work Location: In person

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
**Registered Nurse**

**Reports to:** Head of Nursing

**Location:** Stamford, CT

**FLSA Status:** Exempt

**Category:** Regular, full-time

**Compensation:** $32-$37/hr

Anchor Health is seeking a professional Registered Nurse to provide LGBTQ-competent, high-quality, and compassionate care. The Registered Nurse will work closely with other interdisciplinary team members to provide a competent and patient-centered experience.

**About Us:** Anchor Health is Connecticut’s leading health center focused on embracing and promoting the health and wellbeing of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and gender diverse individuals through compassionate, comprehensive, and science-based care in a safe, welcoming, and affirming space. Established in 2016, Anchor Health now sees more than 3,000 patients across two full-service clinics and over 50% are gender diverse. Anchor Health’s services include primary and preventative care, gender-affirming care, HIV prevention and treatment, comprehensive sexual health care, behavioral health care, and more.

**Organizational Snapshot:** We have a team of over 30 employees, including 2 physicians, 4 family nurse practitioners, 4 registered nurses, 5 medical assistants, 4 patient care associates, 2 case managers, 2 pharmacists, 2 pharmacy technicians, and a handful of administrative staff.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide exceptional patient-centered care that is culturally and linguistically appropriate for patient populations.
* Provide care and communicate through a trauma-informed lens.
* Respect patient's identities, pronouns, and autonomy.
* Maintain a daily patient schedule for routine injections, immunizations, patient-education, and triage appointments.
* Complete phone triage and patient assessment.
* Communicate with the interdisciplinary team to assist with the management of patient care.
* Perform high quality and timely documentation in the electronic medical record (EMR), Epic.
* Communicate via phone with patients, external providers, pharmacies, laboratories, insurance companies, and other relevant parties for care coordination.
* Complete medication and imaging prior authorizations.
* Arrange for hospital admissions, laboratory services, imaging services, and specialty referrals.
* Obtain medical and surgical histories, update medication lists, allergies, and problem lists.
* Explain treatment procedures and provide expectations to patients.
* Collect and prepare laboratory specimens for external laboratory testing and on-site point of care testing.
* Assist with medication refills per provider orders.
* Participate in regular staff and clinician meetings.
* Participate in various Anchor Health community events and activities.
* Actively engage in organization-wide cultural competency training.
* Other duties relevant duties as assigned.

**The Ideal Candidate:** The ideal candidate for this role is passionate about LGBTQ health care. Anchor Health is a busy and dynamic workplace, and they should have excellent communication, time management, flexibility, and critical thinking skills.

**Requirements**:

* Current, unencumbered, Registered Nurse (RN) license in the State of Connecticut.
* At least 1 year of clinical nursing experience.
* At least 1 year of nursing experience in the primary care setting.
* Ability to interact professionally and problem solve with all members of the clinical care team, including patients and families, medical staff, pharmacy, case management, administration, and others.
* Ability to relate to a broad range of people and communicate clearly, using tact, discretion, and sensitivity with patients.
* References required for short-listed candidates.
* A criminal background check absent of offenses impacting ability to perform role.
* Anchor Health requires COVID-19 and influenza vaccinations for all patient-facing staff members.
* **Preferred requirements:**
* Spanish language fluency
* Clinical experience working with the LGBTQ community and awareness of needs specific to this population
* At least 1 year of nursing experience with the gender-affirming care or HIV prevention and treatment services.
* At least 1 year of experience with Epic (EHR).

**Compensation and Benefits:** This is a full-time, exempt position. The expected salary range is between $32/hr-$37/hr, commensurate with qualifications and experience.

Our benefits include:

* 18 paid time off (PTO) days per year, to be used for sick time, vacation, and personal time.
* 10 paid holidays each year, including Juneteenth.
* Leave time for military service, jury duty, family and medical emergencies, becoming a parent, losing a family member, and more
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance.
* Employer-sponsored life and long-term disability insurance.
* 401(k) retirement plan with 4% employer match with no vesting period.
* Pre-tax commuter benefits.
* Employee assistance program that includes counseling and referrals to resources for stress, grief, and coping with loss.

***We strongly encourage people of color, trans and nonbinary people, and queer people to apply.*** *Anchor Health is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes everyone, including non-LGBTQ people, to join our team. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, gender identity or expression, affectional or sexual orientation, age, disability, religion or belief, marital status, veteran status, English language proficiency, HIV status, or any other status protected by law, in all phases of employment. These phases include recruitment, advertisement for employment, hiring, placement, compensation, training, promotion, discipline, evaluation, commendations, termination, layoff, and other conditions of employment against any employee or job applicant.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $32.00 - $37.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Free parking
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Internal Medicine
* Primary Care

Physical Setting:

* Clinic
* Outpatient

Supplemental Pay:

* Yearly bonus

Application Question(s):

* The majority of our patients are members of the LGBTQ+ community. Why do you want to work for our organization and help serve this population? (Please do not leave this question blank)

Education:

* Associate (Required)

* Nursing: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

* and unencumbered RN license in the State of Connecticut (Required)

title: Manager Operational Risk - PGIM Risk Management
description:
Job Classification:
Corporate - Risk
A GLOBAL FIRM WITH A DIVERSE & INCLUSIVE CULTURE
As the Global Asset Management business of Prudential, we’re always looking for ways to improve financial services. We’re passionate about making a meaningful impact - touching the lives of millions and solving financial challenges in an ever-changing world.
We also believe talent is key to achieving our vision and are intentional about building a culture on respect and collaboration. When you join PGIM, you’ll unlock a motivating and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading global asset managers!
If you’re not afraid to think differently and challenge the status quo, come and be a part of a dedicated team that’s investing in your future by shaping tomorrow today.
At PGIM, You Can!
What you will do
Reporting to the Vice President, Operational Risk Management of PGIM Executive Office, we are seeking a highly skilled and experienced ORM professional to join our dynamic PGIM Operational risk team.
The successful candidate will play a crucial role in supporting the PGIM affiliates and support functions by providing operational risk management advice and expertise. The PGIM ORM team assists in the identification, communication and mitigation of risks in the businesses, monitors control issues and action plan status, and communicates as appropriate with corporate counterparts. The PGIM ORM team also provides support to governance forums including the PGIM Risk Management Committee and Investment Committee.
This role is based in our office in Newark, NJ. Our organization follows a hybrid work structure where employees can work remotely and/ from the office, as needed, based on demands of specific tasks or personal work preferences. This position is hybrid and requires your on-site presence on a reoccurring weekly basis 3 days per week (Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday)
What you can expect
The Manager of PGIM ORM will be responsible for assisting the PGIM VP of Risk Management with the following responsibilities, among others:* Support the roll-out of the Operational Risk Framework, including participating in risk assessment meetings and workshops with Senior Management in the support functions and businesses; documenting minutes of meetings, key risks and controls and following up on action plans
* Work with the PGIM Chief Risk Officer and the Chair of the PGIM Investment Committee to establish agendas, meeting materials, execute the meetings and prepare minutes;
* Assist in risk aggregation and reporting, including the preparation of risk dashboards, key risk indicators, incident and loss events collection, audit issues reporting, quarterly and annual risk reports;
* Coordinate with the risk officers in the various business units to implement various PGIM and Enterprise Risk initiatives while recognizing the needs of each business unit across PGIM;
* Collaborate closely with the various business units and support functions across PGIM to reinforce risk ownership and accountability and enhance visibility into PGIM affiliates.


What you will bring* The ideal candidate will be a risk professional in the asset management or financial services industry, with a minimum of 4 years of experience in consulting, auditing, or operational risk management.
* The successful candidate will have demonstrated an ability to grow within an organization, adapt and learn quickly and will be a results-oriented individual who can translate plans into actions, and with a strong moral compass.
* The candidate will possess a unique combination of skills including:
* Product knowledge in the financial services industry,
* Exposure to asset management activities,
* Experience in operational risk management activities,
* Experience within an operations, investment or control function is encouraged,
* Excellent project management and multi-tasking skills,
* Strong inter-personal skills and ability to work effectively in a team environment,
* Superior oral and written communication skills


What will set you apart* Highly motivated and detail-oriented, with a strong commitment to accuracy and excellence.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.
* PGIM welcomes all applicants, even if you don't meet every requirement. If your skills align with the role, we encourage you to apply.


What we offer you* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and PTO (Paid Time Off)
* Retirement plans:
	+ 401(k) plan with generous company match (up to 4%)
	+ Company-funded pension plan
* Wellness Programs to help you achieve your wellbeing goals, including up to $1,600 a year for reimbursement of items purchased to support personal wellbeing needs
* Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional health, and career development.
* Tuition Assistance to help finance traditional college enrollment, approved degrees, many accredited certificate programs, and industry designations.


To find out more about our Total Reward package, visit Total Rewards Brochure

title: PGIM Fixed Income - VP, Sales Strategist
description:
Job Classification:
Investment Management - Investments
A GLOBAL FIRM WITH A DIVERSE & INCLUSIVE CULTURE
As the Global Asset Management business of Prudential, we’re always looking for ways to improve financial services. We’re passionate about making a meaningful impact - touching the lives of millions and solving financial challenges in an ever-changing world.
We also believe talent is key to achieving our vision and are intentional about building a culture on respect and collaboration. When you join PGIM, you’ll unlock a motivating and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading global asset managers!
If you’re not afraid to think differently and challenge the status quo, come and be a part of a dedicated team that’s investing in your future by shaping tomorrow today.
At PGIM, You Can!
What you will do
The Sales Strategist role is new to PGIM Fixed Income. It has been identified as a critical role that we are currently missing in driving sales in North America. North American distribution is moving to a regional model from a more channelized approach. The regions will be West, Central, South, Northeast, and Canada. Each regional team will consist of individuals in Business Development, Relationship Management and Consultant Relations. Revenue and Key Performance Indicators will be derived for each region. The regional teams will be supported by client service, reporting, onboarding, marketing, and product functions. A North American Client Council consisting of the Head of US Sales, Head of US Relationship Management, and the Head of Consultant Relations.
The Sales Strategist will be responsible for organizing weekly meetings for each region, setting the agenda for each meeting, managing the pipeline amongst the teams, coordinating with product specialists on the investment desk, tracking results, identifying bottlenecks in the sales process, organizing necessary training, and reporting results, managing consistency between regional teams’ sales process. You will collaborate closely with the North American Client Council, other distribution leaders globally and the Global Head of the Client Advisory Group. You will utilize your analytical problem-solving approaches, intellectual curiosity, and critical thinking capabilities to optimize the business operations of the Institutional Sales team.
The role is a vice president position and will report to the Global Head of the Client Advisory Group. The position is a based in Newark, NJ. Our organization follows a hybrid work schedule where employees currently work in the office three days a week.
What you can expect* Drive alignment across Marketing, Distribution and Portfolio Management Teams
* Lead the management and usage of CRM including driving data cleanup, collaborating with outside vendors, communicating status with the team.
* Report and evaluate success metrics for Institutional salespeople. Develop management reports for Head of Institutional Sales, CEO and senior management that measure and highlight key team activity and pipeline data.
* Ensure critical information is accessible and available across the team by collaborating effectively with internal partners (e.g., Finance, Technology, Investments, Marketing, Product Specialists, Retirement Investment Services, etc.).
* Drive and organize team meeting agendas for members of the North America Client Council to ensure topics are aligned to team objectives.
* Create a system for collecting and sharing key portfolio information across the team.
* Lead efforts with product specialists to communicate critical information about new and existing products that the distribution team needs for clients and other stakeholders.
* Partner with members of North America Client Council to develop presentations for senior leadership of PGIM Fixed Income, PGIM and Prudential.
* Identify and organize training sessions along with North American Client Council to improve sales effectiveness and client retention.
* Collaborate closely with Client Advisory Group senior leaders on sales forecasting and expense budgeting.
* Expand Business Intelligence capabilities to facilitate data driven decision making.
* Create framework for business planning and goal setting via territory segmentation, product prioritization and competitive analyses.
* Coordinate the roll out of new strategies and priority product action plans


What you will bring* 10+ years of experience with leading business management functions in the institutional business.
* Undergraduate degree required; MBA preferred.
* Proven record of utilizing qualitative and quantitative analytical problem-solving approaches; high level of intellectual curiosity and critical thinking capabilities.
* Strong people skills—ability to become a trusted advisor to the senior leaders of the Client Advisory Group and PGIM Fixed Income.
* Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong team ethic: ability to work effectively with other groups in the organization, including Operations, Technology, Finance, Legal and Compliance, Marketing, HR, etc.
* Proficient with Excel Word, PowerPoint, and working knowledge of Salesforce.
* Working knowledge of technology and data tools such as Tableau, Seismic, Power BI, etc.
* Superior abstract reasoning and analytical skills, ability to meet tight deadlines with a high degree of accuracy and multi-tasking ability.


What will set you apart?
A successful candidate for this role will be able to quickly organize disparate teams, gain their confidence, build consensus, resolve conflicts, and help drive positive sales results.* PGIM welcomes all applicants, even if you don't meet every requirement. If your skills align with the role, we encourage you to apply.


What we offer you* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance and PTO (Paid Time Off)
* Retirement plans: 401(k) plan with generous company match (up to 4%) and company-funded pension plan
* Wellness Programs to help you achieve your wellbeing goals, including up to $1,600 a year for reimbursement of items purchased to support personal wellbeing needs
* Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional health, and career development.
* Tuition Assistance to help finance traditional college enrollment, approved degrees, many accredited certificate programs, and industry designations.


To find out more about our Total Reward package, Total Rewards Brochure

PGIM Fixed Income is a global asset manager offering active solutions across all fixed income markets. title: Director of Residential Services
description:
**Job Summary:**

The Director of Residential Services will plan, administer, and direct the operation of care programs.

Salaried position.

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**

* Oversees the daily workflow of the department.
* Conducts performance evaluations that are timely and constructive.
* Handles discipline and termination of employees per agency policy.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Works with the board of directors and department heads to develop short- and long-range plans and goals to provide quality resident care that answers the community’s needs. Allocates financial and space resources among departments based on those decisions.
* Works with comptroller and each department head to develop yearly budgets and effective controls on expenditures. Plans department staffing on basis of projected income and operating expenses.
* Works with comptroller to review resident fee structures and makes necessary adjustments.
* Works with the human resource department and decides on selecting department heads.
* Works with department heads to develop interdepartmental training programs for staff.
* Works with the safety committee to establish safety protocols for the agency and to comply with government health and safety regulations.
* Ensures record keeping in compliance with the agency, DDD, and other governmental and oversight organizations.
* Attends symposia and conferences to stay abreast of new methods and technologies for residential services.
* Works to build community awareness, cooperation, and financial support.
* All staff must cooperate with licensing and/or state inspections or investigations.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Required Skills & Abilities:**

* Excellent management and supervisory skills.
* Familiarity with community support systems, health care and human service resources, court and police activities, etc.
* Good organizational skills and administrative abilities.
* Flexibility in days and hours available for scheduled work, including weekends.
* Knowledge of and the ability to adhere to a professional code of ethics.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related software.

**Education & Experience:**

* Bachelors degree in Business Administration or related field preferred.
* At least three years as a caregiver in a group home or residential setting.
* At least four years of supervisory experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.
* Must pass a physical stating they are in good working health.
* Will be subject to initial and random drug testing during employment.
* Negative Mantoux test must be submitted upon beginning work or within a year of employment.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* On call
* Weekends as needed

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Morris Plains, NJ 07950: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Community Skills Coordinator
description:
***POSITION SUMMARY:*** 

Responsible for the supervision of Community Skills Specialists and Community Skills Assistants. Designs, implements and monitors the program plans for people attending the day program. Encourages, implements and facilitates independence, inclusion, individuality and productivity.

***POSITION DUTIES:*** 

* Manages group settings’ activities and supervises assigned Habilitation staff.
* Supervises and evaluates Community Skills Specialists & Community Skills Assistants.
* Participates as a team member to develop and implement the plans for the people attending the day program.
* Coordinates and provides direction to team members in the assessment of the people attending the day program’s needs and development of appropriate individualized program plans that are in compliance with agency policy as well as State and Federal regulations. Assures integration of services with residential providers.
* Develops and implements meaningful and functional activities reflecting personal interests and the needs of people attending the day program. Implements community based training opportunities and facilitates use of public transportation and public facilities as appropriate.
* Trains and supervises Community Skills Specialists and Community Skills Assistants in job performance i.e. goal/outcome implementation.
* Participates in scheduling on-going in-service training for habilitation staff.
* Provides direction and training to interdisciplinary team members and participates in informal orientation programs for habilitation staff.
* Interviews, hires, disciplines and recognizes staff as needed/appropriate.
* Screens and assesses new people that want to attend the day program. Participates in group activity routines when needed.
* Schedules and attends all annuals, semi-annual and special conferences for the people attending the day program.
* Reviews all records for accuracy and completeness.
* Ensures that habilitation staff are entering daily recording activities, goals in Precision Care software for the people attending our day program and reviews accordingly. Ensures documentation of services are delivered contemporaneously, attendance, progress notes, etc.
* Acts as a liaison to outside professionals regarding the people attending our day program.
* Assist with ADL Care (feed, personal hygiene, toileting) care to the people that are attending the day program as needed.
* Performs all other duties as assigned.

\\_ **QUALIFICATIONS:** \\_

* Bachelor’s degree in education or related field required.
* QIDP Status.
* Minimum 2 years’ experience working in a program for people with developmental disabilities.
* Supervisory experience preferred.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications
* Knowledge of PrecisionCare software preferred
* Must be able to work outside as appropriate for the activity.
* Valid Driver’s license preferred.
* Performs all job responsibilities in full compliance with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, policies and procedures. Adheres to the agency’s corporate compliance program, including the code of business conduct, the NYS and federal false claims acts, whistleblower protections and mandatory reporting. Completes corporate compliance training at least annually. Fully cooperates in all corporate compliance investigations and reviews

* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

title: Catering Attendant - NYC (Breakfast)
description:
Our On-Site Catering Attendants are the faces of our company who help facilitate the day-to-day meal operations at some of our biggest clients. You will make certain that you provide the best experience possible by engaging and building genuine relationships with the companies we partner with. While ensuring that every meal goes off without a hitch, you’ll get the benefit of exposure to different offices and clients, many of which are exciting tech startups like Zerocater. You are a subject matter expert and enthusiastic spokesperson for Zerocater because you agree that the best ideas happen over food. You'll be on-site to answer questions, chat with clients and coworkers, and have the opportunity to make new friends and connections!


**What you will do:**

* Facilitate Delivery Intake: Help ensure smooth transportation of the food delivered by the vendor from the loading dock up to the client’s meal space.
* Oversee Meal Set-up: Guide and help with food layout, set up special equipment if needed, manage overall presentation, and replenish dishes.
* Meal Feedback: Take inventory of food before and after a meal, gather employee preference information, communicate with employees on site, and share feedback with HQ.
* Support the team at HQ: administrative office work, organization, and inventory.
* Other tasks as designated by departmental management.

**Qualifications for success:**

* Background in hospitality, food service, or a similar customer-facing role.
* You are willing to work as a team and help others out to ensure smooth execution.
* You are responsible and attentive and can work effectively with little supervision.
* You have a real passion for food service and a customer first mentality.
* Must have a Food Handler's Certificate or be willing to obtain one (the cost of which will be covered by Zerocater).

**Physical requirements:**

* Able to lift at least 40 pounds
* Able to kneel, crouch and bend
* Able to walk up and down flights of stairs
* Able to stand & walk for 3-4 hours on shift
* Must be at least 18 years of age

*Some client sites require you to be fully vaccinated for Covid-19. If you are presented with an offer of employment for one of these sites, you would be required to present proof that you are fully vaccinated as of your start date. Fully vaccinated is defined as two weeks after the last shot in a vaccination regimen. Some sites may also require a booster in a vaccination regimen. If you are not fully vaccinated, you would be eligible to work at a client site that does not require vaccination.*

**Compensation:**

* You will work part-time, at $21.00 per hour
* Must be available to work Monday-Thursday 7:00AM- 11:00AM
* You will receive a set schedule each week


“The shared meal elevates eating from a mechanical process of fueling the body to a ritual of family and community, from the mere animal biology to an act of culture.” -Michael Pollan


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommodations@zerocater.com


Zerocater builds revolutionary corporate catering and cafeteria solutions employees love while saving companies millions of dollars as they transition to the hybrid workplace. With its Cloud Cafe, Hybrid Cafe, Managed Cafe, and Event Cafe products; Zerocater has built corporate cafeteria and office catering programs for companies of all sizes from growing startups to the Fortune 500. Thousands of companies like Robinhood, Datadog, Airtable, and McKinsey choose Zerocater for the customized, consistent, and diverse meal experiences its products offer, while also reducing costs by giving companies the flexibility to only pay for the employees who come into the office. Zerocater currently offers its corporate cafeteria and office catering products in the San Francisco Bay Area, New York, Chicago, Los Angeles, Boston, Austin, Denver, Seattle, and Washington D.C. with additional markets in the U.S. and Canada coming online every month. Since completing YCombinator in Winter 2011, Zerocater has raised $38.5M from leading investors including Cleveland Avenue, Remus Capital, Romulus Capital, Struck Capital, SV Angel, Keith Rabois, Yuri Milner, Paul Buchheit, and Justin Kan. For more information visit zerocater.com and follow @Zerocater on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter.  

For more information, please visit: zerocater.com.


Pay: $21 / hour


Benefits:

* 401(k) matching


Job Type: parttime


Education: No education required


Work location: On-site

title: NURSE PER DIEM 7-3/3-11/11-7
description:
**GENERAL SUMMARY:** The Licensed nurse helps to fulfill the care requirements of our residents. Under the direction of the nurse manager, the nurse will work within their entire scope of practice. He/she will be fully accountable for ensuring that competent care and safety are consistently delivered to all residents. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: • Provides nursing care within their scope of practice and in accordance with standards of care established by the facility.
  
  

* Assists with the development and revision of nursing care plans. Manages/directs the plan of care by directly administering care or by directing and supervising nursing duties delegated to nursing assistants. • Checks and records vital signs on a regular basis following established policy or at own discretion if the need exists. • Assists with residents’ comfort.
* Maintains accurate and complete records of nursing care provided. • Reports significant observations to the nurse in charge/ designee and physicians. • Reports pertinent changes in condition to the physician and the resident/health care decision maker. • Participates in purposeful daily rounds.
* Prepares and administers medications after appropriate orientation and instruction. • Maintains accurate medication records and observes residents for signs and symptoms of adverse drug reactions. • Administers special treatments, procedures, dressing changes, irrigations and other procedures requiring special techniques based on her/his nursing education and scope of practice. • Collects specimens.
* Accompanies physician on rounds when necessary; reviews physician’s orders, medications, and records to ensure prompt and accurate execution. • Attends staff education, training and other required meetings. • Maintains a clean, safe, and organized work space. • Monitors consistent application of Restorative Nursing Goals and Approaches and refers any necessary changes to the Charge Nurse for evaluation.
* Answers resident call lights promptly. • May come in contact with blood and other infectious materials, follows Universal Precautions Directs and provides assistance, observes, and monitors the activities of Nursing Assistants. • Contributes to the evaluation of CNA performance as requested. • Assure that the HIPAA and Assignment of Benefits/Medical Treatment Consent forms have been signed upon resident’s admission and placed in the Admission Director’s mailbox for processing the next day.
* Other related duties and responsibilities as may be assigned, within the scope of her/his education and under direct supervision of a Registered Nurse. KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED: • Empathy and compassion • Effective verbal and written communication • Ability to read, write, and speak English • Astute observation skills • Ability to follow set rules and protocols • Time management and organizational skills • Sense of responsibility • Desire to work with others • Understand and carry out exactly, detailed oral and written instructions • Ability to keep records and make reports • Ability to secure cooperation with residents • Possess a working knowledge of nursing techniques and their relation to medical and surgical practices EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: • Graduate of an accredited School of Nursing • Must be 18 years of age or older LICENSURE, CERTIFICATION OR REGISTRATION REQUIRED: • Current Basic Life Support (CPR) certification • Current Licensed Nurse in NJ

title: Spanish Speaking CHHA for Saturdays/ Dementia Client
description:
If you are looking for an immediate job opportunity and have experience or are looking to enter the home health care industry for the first time, don't hesitate to apply today! We invite you to take the next step in your career and join our team. We are eager to meet you and learn more about why you are the perfect fit for our team. title: Care coordinator
description:
**This is not a remote postition**


**Job Title:** Care Coordinator, MA (Telemedicine Programs Specialist)

  


**Location:** Morristown, NJ

  


**Type:** Full-time


**Overview**



The Care Coordinator is a critical role designed to facilitate and enhance telemedicine services, including Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) and Chronic Care Management (CCM), for patients residing in Skilled Nursing Facilities (SNF). This position serves as the pivotal link between the patients in the SNF and the remote clinical team of a third-party provider, focusing exclusively on managing and coordinating telemedicine care programs. The Care Coordinator does not perform duties within the SNF itself but rather works on behalf of a third-party company to ensure effective and successful delivery of care through telemedicine services.

  


**Responsibilities**



Act as the primary liaison between SNF patients and the remote clinical team, coordinating telemedicine services such as RPM and CCM.



Facilitate the creation and implementation of patient-centered care plans by working closely with remote healthcare providers, specifically tailored to telemedicine frameworks.



Ensure continuous monitoring and assessment of patient conditions, coordinating the flow of vital data between the SNF and the remote clinical team.



Educate and support both patients and SNF staff on the effective use of telemedicine programs, promoting optimal management of chronic conditions and healthcare outcomes.



Advocate for the patient’s needs, ensuring they receive comprehensive and effective care through the telemedicine programs.



Bridge communication and operational gaps between SNF staff and the remote clinical team to ensure seamless delivery of telemedicine services.



Manage and maintain patient records, ensuring accurate and timely communication of health data between the SNF and the remote clinical team.



Monitor and evaluate patient progress within telemedicine programs, working collaboratively with all parties to adjust care plans and interventions for better health outcomes.


**Qualifications**



Certification as a Medical Assistant or in a related healthcare field.



Experience in telemedicine, RPM, or CCM programs, with a strong understanding of care coordination within these settings.



Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively and coordinate between patients, healthcare providers, and facility staff.



Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with the capacity to manage complex care programs and detailed patient data.



Proficiency in electronic medical records (EMR) and telemedicine platforms, with a high level of digital literacy.



Knowledgeable in medical terminology, chronic condition management, and the specific requirements of telemedicine care delivery.



Independent worker with team collaboration skills, committed to enhancing patient care and outcomes through effective telemedicine coordination.


**Ideal Candidate**



The ideal candidate is a dynamic and empathetic professional, skilled in navigating the nuances of telemedicine and adept at coordinating care between remote clinical teams and patients in SNFs. This role is perfect for someone passionate about leveraging technology to improve healthcare delivery and patient outcomes in a telemedicine setting.

  


**To Apply**: Please submit your resume and a cover letter that highlights your experience with telemedicine programs, specifically RPM and CCM, and your proficiency in care coordination within these frameworks.

  



[Company Name] is committed to diversity and inclusion and invites applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of their background

title: RN Supervisor/Charge Nurse
description:
**CNA Responsibilities:**

* Providing great patient care.
* Answering patient calls and determining how best to help them.
* Providing physical support for patients or residents with daily activities and personal hygiene, including bathing, dressing, getting out of bed, - using the toilet, walking, standing, or exercising.
* Turning and repositioning bedridden patients.
* Ensuring patients or residents receive appropriate diet by reviewing their dietary restrictions, food allergies, and preferences.
* Obtaining a wide range of information from physicians, caregivers, and nurses about patient conditions, treatment plans, and suggested activities.
* Measuring and recording food and liquid intake and urinary and fecal output and reporting changes to medical or nursing staff.
* Recording vital signs, including blood pressure, pulse, temperature, and respiration rate as requested by staff.
* Examining patients to detect issues requiring medical care, including open wounds, bruises, or blood in the urine.
* Reminding patients to take medications and nutritional supplements.
* Noting observations of patient behavior, including complaints, or physical symptoms to nurses.
* Stay up to date on CNA training and facility policy and procedure.

**CNA Requirements:**

* State Certified Nursing Assistant Certification.
* Current CPR (American Heart Association).
* Nursing degree from a CNA program.
* Ability to think and work independently and with direction, and communicate with staff members in a fast-paced and sometimes stressful environment.
* Current certification as a Certified Nursing Assistant.
* High School graduate or equivalent.
* Current identification.
* Comfortable using a computer.
* Excellent personal hygiene.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!


If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.


Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.


* We love all pets like our own
* We’re the future of the pet industry
* We’re here to improve lives
* We drive outstanding results together
* We’re welcome as we are


Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong and operate 1,500+ pet care centers in the U.S., Mexico and Puerto Rico, including 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics and eight distribution centers. We’re focused on purpose-driven work, and strongly believe what’s good for pets, people and our planet is good for Petco.

**Position Purpose:**


The purpose of this position inherently involves providing excellent medical care to our Vetco Total Care full-service hospital patients and phenomenal customer care to their owners. The Veterinary Assistant represents the mission and values to all clients. Our Veterinary Assistants set the tone for the technical and customer support in the hospital, and are responsible, like all team members, for fostering cohesion and motivation within the practice.


All hospital staff are responsible for performing their duties in a way that creates an environment in which:

* The patient’s needs always come first.
* Every team member understands that they have the power to do what it takes to create an exceptional customer experience.
* contentious issues are dealt with and resolved as they occur when possible, or as soon as is possible.
* exceptional teamwork and commitment to shared goals benefits the entire organization.

**Essential Job Functions**

*The incumbent must be able to perform all the following duties and responsibilities* w*ith or without reasonable accommodation:*

* Greet clients and patients arriving for appointments and escort them into an exam room, obtain weight and vital signs (temperature, pulse, respirations) and record the electronic medical record. Veterinary Assistants will collect thorough patient histories and document the patient visit in the EMRs.
* Assist doctors with appointments (routine and emergency), surgery, dentistry, and euthanasia, under supervision from the veterinarian credentialed veterinary technician, , HOM and HLOD.
* Perform patient restraint, obtain and process laboratory samples, handle and dispense medications at the direction of the veterinarian and help maintain the electronic medical record.
* Schedule appointments, provide client education, relay test results to doctor and clients, and maintain and update client/patient records.
* Help prepare patients for surgical and dental procedures and assist doctor and/or veterinary technician in anesthetizing patients. Under supervision of the veterinarian and/or veterinary technician, assistants will maintain patients safely under anesthesia while monitoring vital parameters, help monitor patients during recovery and prepare them for hospital discharge or transfer to an overnight care facility.
* Under supervision of the veterinarian and/or veterinary technician, perform in-hospital treatments for sick patients including giving injectable and oral medications as well as intravenous fluid therapy; keep patients clean, watered, and fed (when indicated and directed by doctor), safely walk canine patients when necessary for elimination.
* Under direction of the HOM/HLOD, assist in the training of new staff members and general dissemination of knowledge as required.
* Keep hospital environment neat and clean; perform regular cleaning of environment based on necessity as well as based on a pre-determined maintenance schedule.

**Other Duties and Responsibilities**

* Perform additional duties as assigned
* Provide backup phone and front desk support as needed

**Nature of Supervision**


In all activities related to the care of individual patients, the incumbent will take direct supervision from the veterinarians as well as the Veterinary Technician. For purposes of overall supervision, the incumbent takes direction from the HOM/HLOD or from the supervising technician for the shift.

**Planning and Problem Solving**


Like all team members, the Veterinary Assistant plays a crucial role in ensuring that day-to-day operation of the hospital is efficient and provides an optimal experience for our patients and clients.

**Impact**


This position will impact the organization by contributing to the growth of productive practice while focusing on a high-quality standard of care. From an overall hospital organizational standpoint, this position in critical to ensuring that we have a cohesive, well-trained, and motivated technical team. The desired end-result is the creation of an optimal environment that ensures employee retention, patient well-being, and customer satisfaction.


**Supervisory Responsibility**


This position has no immediate supervisory duties.

**Education/Experience**

* Preferred to have at least 1-year previous experience working in veterinary practice or sufficient relatable animal care experience to ensure excellent performance at the above-listed skills
* Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Must be compassionate and sympathetic, and be able to maintain a professional attitude and demeanor during emotional and stressful situations
* Must have telephone and computer skills
* Must be a team player willing to learn new techniques and treatments, offer creative ideas, and accept change

**Work Environment:**


The majority of job duties are conducted in the Veterinary Hospital. Position requires bending, kneeling, lifting (up to 30 pounds, as necessary) and standing for long periods of time. A large amount of this partner’s time will be spent in direct contact with clients and their pets.


**Contacts**


This position will regularly communicate with clients, veterinary specialists, and companies that provide products and/or services that the practice utilizes.


Petco Animal Supplies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification.

title: DIRFloortime Player
description:
**About Kinder Growth**



At Kinder Growth we strive to support children with autism in building strong, meaningful and enjoyable relationships with those around them. We work to support children in unlocking their potential to bring forth a happier and more engaged child.



Start your journey with us today!


**Here’s what we’re looking for…**



We are seeking playful and energetic DIRFloortime Player to play with autistic youths. Our DIRFloortime players work in the home providing one to one DIRFloortime therapy sessions. Flexible and part time hours, including evenings and weekends, with the availability to build a full time caseload.


**Benefits Offered:**


* Flexible and part time hours, including evenings and weekends, with the availability to build a full time caseload.
* Career Advancement: Extensive support for those interested in advancing in an evolving field.
* Supervision: Regular direct supervision and mentoring by DIRFloortime credentialed professionals.
* Training: Meet with other DIRFloortime Players under the supervision of clinical leadership for a monthly team meeting and training on various topics related to DIRFloortime.
* DIRFloortime training reimbursement
* No more than a 30 minute commute, with client-to client mileage reimbursement.
* Full time employees: Health Insurance.


**Here’s what your role as a DIRFloortime Player may look like ...**


* "Befriending" the youth.
* Playing 1:1 to support the child in development.
* Video your session to reference back to when reflecting on sessions.
* Light data collection.
* Use positive, affective approaches to create meaningful change.


**DIRFloortime Player Employment Requirements:**


* Bachelors Degree and 1 year related experience or education required (Education, Counseling, Psychology, Sociology, Developmental Intervention, RBT/ Behavior technician)
* Valid form of ID
* Pass Federal and State background checks
* Must have reliable transportation
* Ability to play on the floor
* Working device to take session data and video sessions


**COVID-19 Precautions:**


* Remote interview process
* Virtual meetings


**Join Our Team!**


* We take great pride in the Kinder Growth work environment. Our emphasis on employee happiness, growth, collaboration and communication are our guiding values when it comes to our staff. We recognize the value of our staff and their potential to contribute to our Kinder Growth team.


Job Types: Full-time, Part-time



Pay: $25 per hour



Education:


* Bachelor's (required)


Experience (1 year required) :


* Child care ( babysitting, daycare, preschool teacher, assistant teacher )
* Special education ( educational settings, special needs )
* Developmental intervention ( early intervention )
* Autism interventions (RBT/ Behavioral technician, Autism support specialist, ABA therapist, other DIRFloortime experience)


Work Location: Multiple Locations

title: Middle School Math Teacher
description:
*Future Leaders Institute Charter School (FLI)*, in the heart of Historic Harlem, is a neighborhood K-8 charter school serving a diverse student population of 364. FLI’s mission is to immerse our students in a rich and rigorous educational experience, within a nurturing school environment. We focus on high academic standards while fostering and developing each student’s leadership skills and character. We take pride in offering an academically rigorous educational program, with a strong emphasis on Social Emotional Learning.

Our Instructional Leadership team collaborates with teachers to ensure that each student achieves academic success and builds proficiency in 21st century skills. We achieve this through well-organized curricula and data-driven small group instruction. FLI teachers are facilitators of learning, providing assessment-driven instruction from standards-based curricula that are unified across Kindergarten to 8th grade. Our teachers integrate technology in learning through the use of laptops and tablets. This has allowed us to better differentiate and individualize instruction. For example, using the iReady program, each student receives appropriate individual instruction. In the years ahead, FLI will continue to refine and expand our keyboarding and coding courses, to best prepare our students for the demands of the 21st century.

We place the highest priority on teaching the whole child. All teaching follows the Responsive Classroom approach to instruction, and we have a positive school culture oriented around our core values of Leadership, Responsibility, Respect, Effort, Compassion, and Truth. Each FLI student takes on meaningful and unique leadership roles, responsibilities, and initiatives within the school community. FLI staff work collaboratively with students to solve community-wide challenges.

**We are looking for teachers to join our FLI team! We look forward to meet all candidates committed to FLI’s Mission:**

\\* Always taking a student-centered approach to instruction and classroom management

\\* Collaborating with Instructional Leaders to enhance and maintain FLI’s curricula

\\* Maintaining a growth mindset

\\* Active participation in our Professional Development Programs

\\* Adopting a blended learning program within the classroom to support differentiated and individualized grade-level instruction

**We Support All New Teachers! Your success is Our success!**

**Our Year-One Teacher’s Program includes:**

\\* August workshops: New teacher training, IEP analysis, curriculum overview and unit planning, Advisory and Restorative Practices

\\* A dedicated Teacher Mentor

\\* Ongoing: Classroom modeling and coaching, with our Instructional Leadership Team, throughout the first year….

**Qualifications:**

\\* NYS certification

\\* Strong organization skills

\\* Experience teaching middle school mathematics

\\* Strong communication skills

\\* Previous training or familiarity with Responsive Classroom approach to instruction (preferred)

\\* Familiarity with i-Ready, an online assessment tool (preferred)
