title: Retail Sales – Part Time
description:
We are happy you have taken time out of your day to check out this Retail Sales Associate opportunity with Lowe's. Do any of the following statements match your current goals?* I'm at least 18 years old, and I want to share my whole self in an inclusive work environment
* I want to work for a company who welcomes and appreciates the military community
* I'm retired, but I still want to work part-time or full-time
* I currently have a job and need supplementary income
* I want to build a career with a company that doesn’t require a four-year degree
* I'm a stay-at-home parent, ready to return to work
* I need flexibility in my schedule because I have children or other responsibilities
* I'm interested in debt-free education, tuition reimbursement, or certificate programs
* I want to learn a skilled trade and possibly start my own company
* I am bilingual
* I love DIY projects

  

Whatever your need for employment, we at Lowe's believe we can help you build a better life and career, and we are all-in to help you achieve your goals. We are hiring immediately for this role, so make sure you apply today.  

  

**Here's what you will do in this role:**  

As a Lowe's **Retail Sales Associate – Part-Time**, you are the key to our customers' positive shopping experiences. You will be the smiling person who greets customers as they enter our doors or shop our aisles. You will engage customers regarding the types of projects they are working on and how you may help. You will guide shoppers to the right products or introduce them to the appropriate sales specialist who can assist. As you learn more about your department and Lowe's, you will understand which products naturally go together. It will be your responsibility to ensure that you share this knowledge with your customers. Here's an example: If a customer is looking for a lamp, do they need a shade? What about light bulbs? See, it's that simple!  

  

Lowe's offers jobs for people who aren't interested in sitting behind a desk for hours. Instead of answering phones, you might be in the store or the garden center, walking, talking to our customers, watering plants, and restocking items. Depending on your department, some lifting (building materials, paint, or maybe mulch) may be required with or without assistance.  

  

**What's in It for You?**  

Beyond the chance to make a difference for customers and teammates, each day will allow you to learn, grow, and celebrate wins together with your Lowe's team. Our associates enjoy the following benefits:  

* A 10% discount on everything at Lowe's
* Eligible for debt-free education and skilled trade programs
* Access to comprehensive physical, mental, and financial benefits\\*
* Opportunity to earn quarterly bonuses
* Flexible schedules to fit your lifestyle
* Career growth—over 50% of our leaders started as hourly associates

  

**Your Day at Lowe's**  

* Deliver excellent customer service
* Help customers find products and provide recommendations
* Help load customer merchandise
* Restock merchandise

  

**Requirements**  

* Be able to lift up to 25lbs. unassisted, or over 25lbs assisted.
* Possess 6 months experience operating common retail technology, smartphones, tablets, or computers.
* For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, email HRServiceCenter@lowes.com.

  

***Bilingual applicants are encouraged to apply.***  

  

* Benefits offerings change each year and eligibility varies. For the most up-to-date breakdown of what's available to you, visit MyLowesBenefits.com.

  

***Bilingual, Military, and Veteran applicants are encouraged to apply.****Lowe’s is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.*


Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit https://talent.lowes.com/us/en/benefits.
company_description: Lowe's is an American chain of retail home improvement and appliance stores that has retail stores in the United States.

title: High School Limudei Qodesh Teacher
description:
**High School Limudei Qodesh Teacher**

Abraham Joshua Heschel School of Manhattan is seeking a full-time teacher for 2024-2025 to join the high school’s Limudei Qodesh department. The high school Limudei Qodesh department teaches *Tanakh*, Talmud and other genres of Rabbinic literature, and Jewish Philosophy. Members of the Limudei Qodesh department also facilitate a daily *Shacharit* minyan.  



Applicants should have a passion for teaching texts and a proven track record of outstanding differentiated instruction to students of different abilities and learning styles. A Bachelor’s degree is required; professional training in education and/or a graduate degree preferred.  



Candidates must be proficient in both biblical and rabbinic texts, and have a love of teaching and learning these texts in their original languages. Applicants are expected to be passionate about fostering connections between a diverse student body and our sacred texts. Candidates should enjoy working collaboratively with colleagues to develop and implement curricula and must be passionate about their personal and professional growth.  



Abraham Joshua Heschel School, located in New York City, is an independent Jewish school, N-12, unaffiliated with any single movement or synagogue. The school's approach to education is governed by profound respect for children. We nurture children’s curiosity, cultivate their imagination, encourage creative expression, value their initiative and engender critical thinking skills. The Heschel School is dedicated to inspiring its graduates to become responsible adults and active, compassionate citizens of the Jewish world and world communities.  



Abraham Joshua Heschel School is a dual-curriculum Jewish community school with families from a range of backgrounds, practices, and beliefs. We are pluralistic and deeply value openness to a diversity of opinions. Our Limudei Qodesh curriculum is text-based and values-oriented. We balance formal and creative approaches and integrate the teaching of text skills with themes of individual and communal identity.  



Qualified applicants should upload a cover letter and resume. To be considered, applicants must apply using the follwing link:

https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=5db03d9d-83a7-470f-a3eb-1942264884b7&ccId=19000101\\_000001&jobId=506967&source=CC2&lang=en\\_US  



In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.  



Abraham Joshua Heschel School is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  



The full-time equivalent salary range is $55,000 - $95,000, depending on years of experience.

title: Medical Assistant
description:
```Job Summary```  
We are seeking a skilled and compassionate Medical Assistant to join our team. The Medical Assistant will provide essential support to healthcare professionals, ensuring the smooth operation of our medical facility. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in medical administrative support and possess knowledge of medical terminology and coding. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is passionate about patient care and wants to make a difference in the lives of others.

```Duties```  
- Perform basic clinical tasks such as taking vital signs, preparing patients for examinations, and assisting with procedures  
- Provide exceptional patient service, ensuring their comfort and addressing any concerns or questions they may have  
- Assist with medical coding and maintaining accurate patient records  
- Collaborate with healthcare professionals to ensure the highest quality of patient care  
- Maintain a clean and organized work environment

```Qualifications```  
- High school diploma or equivalent required; completion of a Medical Assistant program preferred  
- Certification as a Medical Assistant is highly desirable  
- Strong knowledge of medical terminology and anatomy  
- Proficiency in performing vital signs measurements accurately  
- Previous experience in a hospital or clinical setting is preferred  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  
- Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively

We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, including health insurance, paid time off, and opportunities for career growth. If you are a dedicated individual with a passion for patient care, we would love to hear from you.

Please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted for further consideration. Thank you for your interest in joining our team as a Medical Assistant.

title: Apprentice
description:
Who we are
For more than 40 years, Reworld has been a leader in sustainable waste solutions, providing our customers with innovative solutions that help them achieve carbon-negative outcomes.
Our Vision
Reworld is leading the charge to a carbon-negative future through revolutionary sustainable materials management solutions that reduce, reuse, recycle and reimagine waste for the benefit of society and the environment.
Our Business
Reworld partners with businesses by offering cutting-edge engineering and innovative solutions, to help customers reduce, reuse, recycle and recover value from waste streams and meet or exceed their sustainability goals.
Our Value
Reworld's differentiator comes from our ecosystem of technology, facilities and partnerships, trusted by the world’s largest organizations to reimagine waste management for a smarter, more sustainable world.
All that we’re missing is you. Apply today!
About the role*The expected hourly rate for this position is* *$**21.71**.*
Apprentice Engineer, reporting to either the Maintenance Supervisor or the Shift Supervisor will perform basic job functions such as grease equipment, replace light bulbs, assist Maintenance personnel, assist Auxiliary Engineer(s), assist Water Systems Operator(s), clean equipment, clean the Facility and perform other assignments as directed by the Maintenance/Operations Supervisor. The Apprentice Engineer will train for and perform Maintenance and Auxiliary Engineer job functions as his skill level increases and as directed. The Apprentice Engineer will work independently on minor tasks, such as cleaning, and his independence will increase as his job knowledge increases. The Apprentice Engineer must attend Union required training classes and participate in company training programs.
Job Requirements:
A high school diploma. Applicants with Resource Recovery Facility experience will be given preference. Interest, desire, and ability to learn plant operations for future promotion to Auxiliary Engineer position. Willing to work over time both scheduled and in response to unscheduled demand maintenance.
Our DEI Commitment
Reworld is an Equal Opportunity Employer, has developed an Affirmative Action Program (AAP), and will not discriminate against any qualified applicants because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability (including perceived disability, physical, mental, and/or intellectual disabilities), veteran status, liability for service in the Armed Forces of the United States, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

Know Your Rights (Click to view poster)  

Please note that Level, Title and/or Salary may be adjusted based on the applicant's experience or skills.  

If you are an individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to access job openings or apply for a job on this site because of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by going to Reworldwaste.com and clicking on the ‘Contact Us’ button. Under Inquires, select ‘Careers’ in the Interest field, fill out all required fields including your message. In the message section, please note this is a ‘Job Application Accommodation Request’.

title: Director of Patient Services, RN
description:
**Gurwin Certified and Licensed Home Care Services Agencies** are looking for a full-time **Director of Patient Services (DPS)**.



Gurwin Healthcare System is a full continuum of care providing extraordinary care and caring to the people that we serve. Set on a 36-acre campus in Commack, NY, the Gurwin Healthcare System includes the 460-bed Gurwin Jewish Nursing & Rehabilitation Center, providing short-term rehabilitation and long-term skilled nursing care, memory care, respiratory and ventilator care, palliative and hospice care, social and medical adult day programs, and on-site dialysis and infusion therapy. Sharing the campus is Gurwin’s Assisted Living community (Gurwin Jewish ~ Fay J. Lindner Residences), our independent living community (Fountaingate Gardens).



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:



A current New York State Nursing license. A BSN from an accredited NLN program and a minimum of five years of progressively responsible experience in the provision of nursing services in a home health setting. Master’s Degree in Nursing preferred. Advanced management, administrative and decision making skills congruent with responsibilities.

  



KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:



Extensive knowledge of the principles and practice of community health nursing and its relationship to other human services. Superior clinical knowledge based on application, with in-depth understanding of case management and community resources/needs. Knowledge of Medicare/NYS Department of Health regulations, guidelines and policies. Ability to develop care plans for patients.

  



PRINCIPAL FUNCTIONS:


* The Director of Patient Services is responsible for the administration of the program and the overall clinical direction and supervision of patient care services.
* Assumes professional responsibility for the CHHA and integrated programs.
* Provides leadership and direction of clinical staff for program services and policies of the organization. This involves planning, organizing, directing, monitoring and evaluating as well as assuring compliance with State, Federal and Agency standards.
* Works closely with Executive Team, appropriate management staff and committees to facilitate program coordination and implementation.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Assists in recruiting and provides input to meet the program’s responsibilities.
* Plans, delegates, supervises and evaluates patient care services provided by the program directly, by fee-for service or by contract.
* Provides clinical supervision of staff to assure standards of care are met and or assures that appropriate supervision is provided.
* Carries out the CHHA mission, philosophy, goals and objectives within the guidelines of agency policy and position function.
* Develop, review, maintain and assure implementation of clinical service delivery policies, procedures and objectives.
* Collaborates with Human Resources and Director to monitor and assure that regulations and mandated requirements are followed.
* Collaborates with and assists Director in the development, implementation and monitoring of the annual budget by recommending staffing plans, productivity volume estimates, as well as needed supplies and equipment that will accomplish program goals.
* Assures the presence and implementation of staff development activities that include but are not limited to orientation, performance evaluation, Quality Assurance Performance Improvements, and continuing in-service education.
* Serves as a clinical resource to the Executive Team.


We offer an excellent salary, dynamic work environment and a comprehensive benefits package.


**Benefits:**


* Medical Insurance (Anthem Blue Cross Blue Shield) for eligible employees, plus a family option. Includes:



o Fitness Reimbursement Program



o Wellness discounts


* Dental Insurance through MetLife


* Vision Insurance through Anthem Blue Cross Blue Shield (EyeMed)


* Accrued holiday/personal and vacation time; payout for unused sick time for those who qualify


* Flexible Spending Account – Medical and/or Dependent Care


* Long term disability Insurance for those who qualify (no cost to employee)


* Life Insurance – value is equal to employee’s annual salary (no cost to employee)


* National Employee Assistance Program (no cost to employee)


* Childcare, membership and program discounts at Suffolk YJCC, Commack and Mid-Island YJCC, Plainview


* Tax deferred annuity plan – employee automatically enrolled with 3% contribution / employer contributes 4% after one year of service (graded vesting)


* Tuition Reimbursement up to $5,000 per year


* Sign-on bonus


* Employee Referral Bonus for specified clinical positions


* Starbuck’s café on-site
* Staff cafeteria with subsidized pricing


* Employee perks including holiday gift cards, System-wide annual BBQ and Winter Celebrations, meals, treats and other theme related staff events





* Other discounts and added value for employees from outside corporations including BJs membership discount, BethpageFCU savings perks, Plum Benefits Entertainment discounts and more!

  


**EOE M/F/D/V**

title: Hiring SCHOOL Registered Nurse in Essex, Union and Bergen Counties
description:
We are seeking a Seasonal Registered Nurse (RN)to work in the Essex, Union and Bergen counties until June 2024.



The School Registered Nurse (RN) will assist pupils and staff in attaining and/or maintaining optimum health, promote positive health habits and attitudes, evaluate the physical conditions of students and refer to appropriate resources. The School RN must be certified as such in the State of New Jersey and comply with all Federal and State licensing regulations.


**REPORTING RELATIONSHIP**



The School Registered Nurse is part of the school’s operations team and will report to the Campus Operations Manager.


**SCHEDULE**



Monday to Friday 07:30 am- 04:00 pm


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Access the physical well-being of the pupil in terms of developmental and present health status;


* Develop policies, procedures, and work standards for school health program


* Monitors compliance of school health program with federal, state, and local laws and agencies.


* Screens and conducts health appraisals for staff and students and maintains records


* Prepares health reports for supervisor, board of education and health department


* Maintains security of school health supplies


* Corresponds with parents on health needs of children


* Manages student health records; Records immunizations, health findings, and other relevant health data


* Provides professional development for staff as requested


* Participates in child study team process as needed


* Maintains and requests orders for equipment/supplies for nurse’s office and first aid station


* Administers medication to students as prescribed by a physician.


* Must be able to catheretize


* Communicate with the School Doctor as necessary and coordinate physicals.


* Must be present at the school as agreed upon with the Executive Director.


**QUALIFICATIONS**


* Considerable knowledge of medical disorders and treatment


* Considerable knowledge of child growth and development


* Working knowledge of public health programs and procedures for treatment in coordination with other health and social service agencies


* Experience in an acute care setting is preferred.


* The school nurse must possess a registered nurse (RN) license and BSN degree. In addition s/he must possess an NJ Department of Education School Nurse Standard


* Certificate or be eligible to obtain certification.


**COMPENSATION**


* Competative salaries being offered. Salary will be evaluated based on experience, skills and qualifications. To be discussed upon interview.


**ABOUT THE SCHOOL**



High-performing, innovative charter public school serving students from Pre-K to 12th grade on campuses across the city. Our mission is to prepare students for success in college and beyond.



Our model is based on the following guiding principles that guide our work daily –


* Creating a community that is built upon genuine and meaningful relationships. *The school staff rate our commitment to students as the #1 reason they teach/work at our schools.*



-Being surgical in our approach to differentiation of instruction and support for all students and team members. *Our students receive daily tutoring embedded into their school schedule - facilitated by our AmeriCorps team members. Staff members receive individualized coaching and support in their roles.*

-Setting and exceeding high expectations for academic growth and character development for all students, in preparation for success in college and beyond. *Currently, the historical college matriculation rate for the school is 79% - nearly twice the national average for economically underrepresented students.*


**-**


**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION**  

**DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION, & ACCESSIBILITY**  

The school is committed to building a talented team that reflects the diverse backgrounds and experiences of our students. Furthermore, we believe that racial justice and equity is critical to our mission of preparing students for success in college and beyond. We strive to be an organization that is diverse, equitable, inclusive, and elevates our student voices in preparing them for life and college.

  

**VACCINATION POLICY & COMMITMENT TO SAFETY**  

This School is committed to ensuring healthy and safe working and learning environments, and maintaining our educational commitment to students and families - with minimal disruption to instruction. With this in mind, as of October 2021, School requires vaccination against COVID-19 for all employees. Candidates who would like to apply for a reasonable accommodation from this policy based on a qualifying disability or sincerely held religious belief should reach out to HR@greatoakslegacy.org for more information.

  

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT**  

School provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws

title: Operations Lead
description:
**Job Description:**


At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.


One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.


Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.


Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

**Job Description:**  

This job is responsible for overseeing a unit or section of a segment for a site, region, or product line within the bank's internal operations. Key responsibilities include identifying, analyzing, and resolving complex problems, ensuring compliance with policies, and identifying opportunities to improve process performance and operating efficiency. Job expectations include knowledge of operations support management and expertise in functional area(s) gained through increasingly more responsible management positions in operations.


The GM (NFRR) team is responsible for the consistent application of interpretation, data sourcing, preparation, governance and oversight of Global Markets regulatory reports – with the overall goal of centralizing and standardizing regulatory reporting across Global Market Operations.  

The Product management function is part of the NFRR team and by partnering with functional stakeholders and technology groups we prioritize and manage change driven by business, legal, regulatory, compliance or market requirements. The function is seeking to recruit associates into a growing team to support the Non-Financial Regulatory Reporting (NFRR) Change program across global regions.  

  

**Responsibilities**:  

* Help deliver a comprehensive product strategy across multiple reporting platforms
* Analyze new and existing regulations against firm practices, assess current state of reports for improvement
* Establish an intake process for new regulations, data incidents, and system fixes
* Establish a robust prioritization model for report automation, product enhancement and data quality upgrades
* Implement effective routines to ensure business requirements are understood, tracked and documented, whilst holding key business and technology partners accountable
* Establish comprehensive, data-informed, and long-term strategy for enhancing reporting platforms and report automation in the portfolio with fully developed tools for maintaining or altering the strategy
* Communicate with a broad audience of business and technology partners in a variety of formats and in a way that ensures all audience members understand and can adhere to the strategy
* You will plan and organize projects using tools and techniques, including Technology platforms used by client facing employees, change management tools, and risk and issue management tools to ensure efficient and effective project completion.
* You will navigate across various Lines of Business and partner organizations, including Technology and Risk, leading them to negotiate decision making for efficient and effective resolution.
* You will be required to communicate across all levels of seniority, providing relevant updates both verbally & through concise metrics & materials
 **Additional Responsibilities:**

* Develops and implements procedures to enhance productivity and efficiency and manage business change
* Serves as an escalation point to resolve broad and complex operational issues
* Responsible for expense management, reporting and forecasting for operations areas managed as well as compensation decisioning, talent planning, and performance management at a senior level
* Manages a large team or multiple smaller teams across one or more sites, regions or product lines in an operations support function
* Supports functions carrying a substantial risk of exposure and potential loss with significant impact on major corporate customer relationships

**Managerial Responsibilities:**  

This position may also have responsibilities for managing associates. At Bank of America, all managers at this level demonstrate the following responsibilities, in addition to those specific to the role, listed above.

* Diversity & Inclusion Champion: Models an inclusive environment for employees and clients, aligned to company D&I goals.
* Manager of Process & Data: Demonstrates deep process knowledge, operational excellence and innovation through a focus on simplicity, data based decision making and continuous improvement.
* Enterprise Advocate & Communicator: Communicates enterprise decisions, purpose, and results, and connects to team strategy, priorities and contributions.
* Risk Manager: Ensures proper risk discipline, controls and culture are in place to identify, escalate and debate issues.
* People Manager & Coach: Provides inspection, coaching and feedback to motivate, differentiate and improve performance.
* Financial Steward: Actively manages expenses and budgets in alignment with objectives, making sound financial decisions.
* Enterprise Talent Leader: Assesses talent and builds bench strength for roles across the organization.
* Driver of Business Outcomes: Delivers results by effectively prioritizing, inspecting and appropriately delegating team work.

**Skills:**

* Business Operations Management
* Drives Engagement
* Process Management
* Process Performance Measurement
* Result Orientation
* Customer and Client Focus
* Planning
* Reporting
* Risk Management
* Talent Development
* Fraud Management
* Interpret Relevant Laws, Rules, and Regulations

**Required Skills**:

* Global Markets Operations Project Management experience
* Process design/migration experience
* Solid understanding of Global Markets
* Ability to identify changes that have an impact across multiple process and stakeholders.
* Identify efficiency gains in regulatory reporting processing
* Hands on approach and process excellence mind set
* Ability to influence and drive progress across key business partners
* Ability to prioritize work and adapt to changing needs in a dynamic work environment
* Track record of delivering projects to plan and on budget.
* Ability to provide clear oral and written communication to a variety of business and technical audiences.
* Experience with regulatory programs – understanding requirements through to implementation
* Experience with regulatory project delivery and interaction via exams, periodic routines etc.
* Knowledge of Operations processing & regulatory requirements.
* Proficient with MS products: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project and Visio.

**Desired Skills**:

* Global Banking / Markets Operations experience – ideally with knowledge of NFRR or similar regulatory mandates would be advantageous.
* Proficiency in process design / mapping would be advantageous.
* Understanding of process migration
* Showing the ability to continually learn and serve our clients better would be an advantage.
* Commitment to challenging the status quo and promoting positive change, utilizing new thoughts and ideas would be an advantage.
* Audit/GIS experience, working in a team environment

**Shift:**


1st shift (United States of America)**Hours Per Week:**


40

title: Program Manager
description:
**Job Description:**


At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.  

  

One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.  

  

Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.  

  

Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!  

  

**Job Description:**  

This job is responsible for overseeing programs and projects specific to corporate change initiatives that impact how the bank does business, provides a product or service, or executes a function. Key responsibilities include serving as the primary contact to department managers for critical change initiatives and communicating, influencing, and negotiating vertically and horizontally to obtain or leverage resources. Job expectations include delivering regulatory and executive material and ensuring results align to program strategy, simplification, and new capabilities.


Initiative Planning Lead responsible for coordinating all NTCO initiative funding requests. Supports annual initiative planning as well as in-year change controls. Works with Change Managers, Opertions Leaders and Technology partners to create and submit new funding requests across all Lines of Business including Global Markets, Global Payments, Wealth Management, Consumer and Global Operations. Facilitates business case development, prioritization, technology sizing and risk analysis.

 **Responsibilities:**  

* Defines program controls, processes, procedures, reporting cadence, decision governance structures, and ways of working with key stakeholders
* Works closely with project sponsors, cross-functional teams, and assigned project managers to develop the scope, deliverables, required resources, work plan, budget, and timing for new change initiatives
* Monitors the execution of defined tasks through tracking of program milestones and their statuses, developing program plans, and measuring progress against ongoing key performance indicators
* Analyzes, evaluates, and overcomes program risks, and produces program reports for managers and stakeholders
* Identifies key requirements for cross-functional teams and external vendors to perform in alignment with the program objectives
* Works with other program managers to identify risks and opportunities across multiple projects within the department, leading them to negotiate decision making for efficient and effective resolution
* Meets with stakeholders to provide transparency into project issues and decisions on services, builds positive relationships, asks questions, and uses tools to uncover root causes to challenges, identify opportunities, and make recommendations.

  

**Skills:**  

* Program Management
* Project Management
* Reporting
* Consulting
* Problem Solving
* Leadership Development
* Performance Management
* Collaboration
* Presentation Skills
* Prioritization
* Issue Management
* Risk Management
* Process Design
* Process Performance Management
* Oral Communications
 **Required Skills**:


Technology Program / Project Management  

Business Case Development  

Initiative Planning  

Regulatory Change Management  

Executive Communication - written and verbal  

Advanced Powerpoint  

Advanced Excel  

Influencing  

Partnership Building  

Conflict Management  

Organization navigation; working in a highly matrixed environment  

Ability to handle high degrees of complexity  

  

**Desired Skills**:


Funding Governance  

Agile Planning  

Process Design / Process Improvement  

Knowledge of Global Markets

**Shift:**


1st shift (United States of America)**Hours Per Week:**


40

title: Montessori Teacher
description:
Netivot, a Montessori school in East Brunswick, NJ, seeks Montessori trained teachers for the Primary (3-5 year olds) and Upper Elementary levels (4th-6th grade) for the 2024-25 school year.
  
  

Candidates must exhibit strong communication skills, have a collaborative, team player mindset, and an intrinsic respect for children. Must have previous experience working in Montessori environments.
  
  

Responsibilities include teaching all curricular areas as part of a team with a co-teacher; presenting all lessons using approved Montessori techniques; recording and reporting on the progress of all students; managing a classroom of 15-20 students using positive discipline; meeting with other team members on a regular basis and maintaining strong team communication; communicating with parents and with supervisors as necessary. Candidates should hold or be in the process of completing teacher certification from a MACTE accredited training program.
  
  

**About the employer:**  

Netivot is widely recognized for bringing authentic Montessori education to the Jewish community. We welcome general studies teachers of all denominations to work alongside our Jewish studies teachers to provide a well rounded educational experience. Our school community includes children from infancy through 8th grade in an empowering, child-centered environment. Our methods are designed to foster independence, mastery of life skills, academic success, and a positive self concept. We welcome you to explore becoming a part of our team!
  
  

Interested applicants should direct their resumes and cover letters to office@mynetivot.com

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.


One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. title: Project Manager
description:
**Job Description:**


At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.


One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.


Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.


Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

**Job Description:**  

Global Banking & Markets Tax Project Manager to manage delivering compliance to new and existing global tax regulation across three primary categories; US Information Reporting & Withholding, Non-US Information Reporting & Withholding and Indirect Taxes.

**Responsibilities****:**

* Project management / Business Analysis skills, including the ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines.
* Project Manage the work stream, including coordination of activities across Operations and Technology
* Oversees the execution of defined project tasks through tracking of deliverables and their statuses, developing project plans, and measuring progress against ongoing key performance indicators.
* Develops, maintains, and reports on an overall integrated delivery plan, raising any risks, developing a mitigation plan, and escalating issues appropriately to respective stakeholders.
* Adhere to enterprise change management standards.
* Work with end users to define functional requirements and prepare User Acceptance Testing
* Oversee User Acceptance Testing execution and Production parallel activities.
* Leads project and/or remediation requirement documentation efforts based on identified gaps and controls needed for sustained performance.
* Navigates across various Lines of Business and partner organizations, including Technology, Operations and Compliance, leading them to negotiate decision making for efficient and effective resolution.

**Required Skills**:

* Knowledge and Understanding of US Tax Withholding and Reporting concepts.
* Proven record of delivering complex projects to plan.
* Ability to manage and communicate with stakeholders at various levels.
* Knowledge of structured project management methods
* Experience of requirements gathering and test preparation
* Experience of working in Financial Service
* Experience in business analysis and project management, including development of formal business requirements documents (BRDs) and / or Agile epics/stories and business process flows as well as functional requirements for technology solutions
* Strong analytical skills and ability to use data to tell a story; leveraging analysis to identify and solve business problems by creating actionable recommendations
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills, including the ability to facilitate and lead remote, cross-functional, cross-location meetings
* Ability to effectively build and maintain strong internal/external relationships and the courage to influence and challenge when necessary
* Detail oriented, intellectually curious, and self-driven; ability to think independently
* Ability to work within an environment with a variety of opinions and priorities and be able to get to a resolution and agreement
* Ability to formulate outputs derived from projects into concise and insightful presentations

title: Residential Coordinator
description:
**Job Brief**  
Ensures the overall care and well being of persons receiving services in assigned residences.

Shift Worked:  
**Flexible** 

Weekly Hours:  
**37.5**

United Cerebral Palsy Associations of New York State, Inc. d/b/a Constructive Partnerships Unlimited (CP Unlimited) is one of New York City's largest and most wide spread Community Living Organizations with programs dedicated to enhancing the lives of people with disabilities.  
CP Unlimited was formerly known as Cerebral Palsy Associations of NYS. Our new name better reflects our wide array of services and programs and the diversity of people with disabilities that our agency supports.  
Our priority is to provide opportunities for people with disabilities to live as independently as possible. Our dedicated staff provide a wide range of direct services and supports that address each person's needs. Our programs are provided within a warm, caring environment, using person-centered planning to address the specific needs of each person. We believe this approach gives people the opportunity to achieve the greatest success.

Currently we are seeking a full time **Residential Coordinator** to join our team of professionals in our **Staten Island Community Living Program**. The Residential Coordinator will ensure the overall care and well-being of persons receiving services in our residential programs. The Residential Coordinator is also responsible for the overall management of the assigned residences and direct supervision of staff, sets performance standards, and provides the support and training necessary for staff to achieve success in their roles.

**Specific Duties for the Residential Coordinator include:**  
Interviews, hires, evaluates staff’s performance, supervises, provides feedback and disciplines Direct Care Counselors, and Supervisors.  
Provides orientation to all new staff and coordinates ongoing training and in servicing as needed.  
Ensures that all staff schedules are accurate and efficient with a sign-off to meet the needs of people who reside in our programs. Ensures adequate staffing is available for all necessary clinic appointments.  
Schedules and conducts routine quarterly meetings as needed.  
Responsible for scheduling all annual medication re-certifications with the Nurse Case Managers or designated RN’s and ensuring documentation is maintained on site.  
Ensures all employee accident reports are completed and submitted to Human Resources in a timely manner. Completes all supervisory investigations.  
Ensures compliance to fiscal year budget in personal services and other expenses for assigned residences.  
Responsible for all financial systems for the people who resided in our programs, including personal funds, household monies, and recreation funds.  
Ensures that fire drills for each shift are implemented and reviewed prior to forwarding to the Administrator for signature and ensures all documentation is on site (i.e. sprinkler reports, quarterly inspections, etc.)  
Responsible for overall maintenance and cleanliness of the assigned residences, completes a biweekly and as needed walkthrough pending site concerns. Ensures that all necessary purchase orders and work orders are generated and ensures timely follow-up of each. Reviews housekeeping cleaning form and conveys any problems to the Administrator of Residential Services.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in related human services field
* A minimum of 3 years’ experience working with developmentally disabled individuals
* QIDP status preferred
* Minimum of two (2) years supervisory experience
* knowledgeable of HCBS Waivers, IRA and ICF regulations
* Must be able to provide weekend coverage as scheduled, work flexible hours as needed
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications.

CP Unlimited values and supports its employees by offering them a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance, pension plan, referral bonus and tuition assistance programs. CP Unlimited also provides a very generous time off package, which includes vacation, personal, sick, professional and holiday days. Working for CP Unlimited you will receive an array of discounts to Broadway shows/movie tickets, cellular services, restaurants, electronics, apparel, health and wellness and more. CP Unlimited invests in its staff over the long term and strives to provide opportunities for professional growth within the agency. The organization always has an eye to the future, exploring ways to improve and expand its services. Develop a career that goes beyond the usual. Become valued as an integral employee of our collaborative team.

**Join our team and reap the rewards!!**

**CP Unlimited is an EOE.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $53,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Ability to Relocate:

* Bronx, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Childcare Assistant
company: Funtastic Tots Family Day Care, LLC
description:
Currently seeking a part-time assistant in the Elmont area to help care for 12-16 children ranging from the ages of six weeks old to twelve year old. Bilingual English/Spanish preferred, but not required. Responsibilities will include, but not limited to feeding, changing, help with meal preparation, homework help, engaging the children with different activities, such as arts and crafts, reading, block playing, etc., taking them to the playground outside in the backyard. The ideal candidate must be 18 years or older, have some experience taking care of children, must pass the state background check, which include being fingerprinted, and be willing to take any required training or certifications. CPR/first Aid a plus!

An energetic, imaginative, collegial, caring, patient, and very attentive individual is a plus!

title: Pediatric Nursing Unit Manager
description:
The Unit Manager (RN) is responsible for managing the individualized Patient care by promoting and restoring patients' health through the nursing process; collaborating with Physicians and multidisciplinary team members; providing physical and psychological support to Patients, Friends, and Families; and supervising assigned team members.



The Unit Manager, RN is responsible to the Clinical Manager for the assigned Department.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Deliver patient care through the facility Nurse activities.
* Administer medicines and intravenous fluids to patients as ordered by Physicians.
* Change wound dressings and care for other treatment options.
* Read and interpret patient information, making treatment decisions when appropriate
* Consult with supervisors and Doctors to decide on the best treatment plan for patients
* Monitor blood pressures, temperatures and vital signs at regular intervals.
* Operate oxygen apparatus, Spiro meters and other diagnosis equipment.
* Observe and report all symptoms and reactions of patients to treatment interventions.
* Assist and support Physician or Doctor in patient care deliveries.
* Direct and supervise Nurses, Nurse Assistants and Nurse Aides.
* Follow established Nursing guidelines and regulations in patient care delivery issues.


Requirements:


* Education: BS in Nursing.
* An Associate's degree in Nursing with applicable work experience may be considered in lieu of a BS.
* NYS license in Nursing with current registration is preferred.


Experience:


* Previous Long term Experience is preferable.
* Good investigative skills.
* Ability to write, educate and work independently.


Job Type: Full-time



Benefits:


* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance


Schedule:


* 8 hour shift, 3:30pm-11pm
* Monday to Friday and every other weekend


Work Location:



One location


**Compensation:**



Competitive compensation ranging from $60 - $71 per hour.

  



If you are a qualified and caring Peds Unit Manager looking for an enriching opportunity to contribute to the well-being of pediatric patients, we encourage you to apply. Join our team at Ditmas Children’s Nursing & Rehab and be a part of a rewarding healthcare environment dedicated to making a positive difference in the lives of children.
company_description: Medical and social care to children with complex medical conditions and/or ventilator dependency. Brooklyn’s highest staff:patient ratio, on-site K-12 education, PT, OT, ST and socialization programs.

title: Facilities Maintenance Specialist
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled **Facilities Maintenance Specialist**.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Maintenance and Repairs:** Perform routine maintenance and repairs in common areas and individual units as needed. Troubleshoot and address minor electrical and plumbing issues.  
Coordinate with external contractors for more extensive repairs and projects.

**Janitorial Duties:** Maintain cleanliness and sanitation of common areas. Regularly clean and maintain the building's interior and exterior spaces. Monitor and restock cleaning supplies as necessary. Manage garbage removal, complying with Freeport Dept. of Sanitation pick up schedules and recycling rules.

**Resident Relations:** Build and maintain positive relationships with owners and tenants. Address resident requests and concerns promptly and professionally. Assist new residents with move-in procedures and orientation to the building. Communicate issues to management.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in building maintenance, janitorial services, or a related field.
* Basic knowledge of gardening, electrical, plumbing, and heating systems.
* Ability to repair sheetrock, including taping, spackling, and painting.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to handle physical tasks.
* Flexibility to work on-call or respond to emergencies as needed.
* Knowledge of Nassau County building codes and regulations is advantageous.

Pay: $25.00 - $32.00 per hour

* Monday to Friday

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
As a **Sales Associate** , you will be collaborative and inclusive in helping our customers while being part of a fun, team-oriented retail culture. You’ll provide exceptional customer service and have our customer’s needs in mind while helping them find products and providing solutions (training provided).


**Get great perks.**

* Flexible part time hours, generous paid time off, weekly pay, training, and career growth opportunities
* Compensation based on qualifications and experience. Hiring immediately
* Associate store discount and more perks (discounts on mobile plans and other retailers, etc.)
* 401(k) plan with a company match, dental and vision insurance, and many more benefits

**Schedule an interview immediately.**

* Schedule an interview potentially within minutes of applying. We'll let you know if you're not eligible. In-person interviews are at the store location

**Help both your customer and your store win.**

* Multitask on cashier, sales and merchandising responsibilities
* Respond quickly and resourcefully to customer requests and concerns
* Create a positive, inviting environment for customers
* Understand and use basic selling skills to engage and present solutions
* Be flexible on responsibilities (e.g., returns, online pick-ups, cleaning, other duties as assigned)

**Essential skills and experience:**

* Able to work a flexible schedule (including nights and/or weekends)
* Must be able to engage and speak to customers and understand their needs
* Collaborate and work with other team members
* Ability to lift/move materials in the 10-50 pound range, climb ladders, stand and walk continuously
* Staples does not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position

**Preferred skills and experience:**

* Customer service or cashier experience in a retail environment

  
The world of working and learning has changed. This is your opportunity to be a part of a brand transformation and growth strategy within the retail industry. Staples is helping our customers and community discover innovative products, services, and inspiration that unlock what’s possible, while empowering you to unlock your potential. Our people are the heart of our success and there has never been a better time to join us as we lead the way in a new era of working and learning.  

  

Want to learn more about Staples Stores? Visit **RetailCareers.Staples.com** for information and to learn about our career opportunities.  

  

  

Learn more about the employee benefits, programs and perks offered at Staples!  

  

*Staples is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.*
company_description: Staples is a world-class retail, online and delivery capabilities leader. In fact, we're one of the world’s top five online retailers.

title: Retail Sales Specialist

title: Head Chef | Recipe Developer | Baker
description:
**Company:** Baketivity

**Location:** Franklin NJ

**About Us:** Baketivity is dedicated to creating fun, educational, and delicious baking experiences for children of all ages. Our monthly subscription boxes include pre-measured dry ingredients, a recipe booklet, and tons of extra kid-friendly content. Each box is designed to teach new baking skills and provide a creative adventure that results in an adorable & tasty treat. We are looking for a passionate and creative head chef to join our team and help us bring joy to kids through baking.

**Job Description:** We are seeking a positive and passionate head chef/recipe developer/baker to lead the creation of our monthly baking kits. The ideal candidate will have a deep love for baking, a knack for developing kid-friendly recipes, and a creative flair that makes every box a unique experience. You will be responsible for designing recipes and appearing in video tutorials that are included in our kits, and on social media. An understanding of children’s capabilities and how to make baking accessible and fun for them is essential.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and test new, seasonally appropriate baking recipes for our monthly kits.
* Create engaging baking tips, and kid-friendly instructions for each recipe.
* Appear in pre-recorded & live video tutorials on social media and other platforms, demonstrating baking techniques and providing a friendly, positive presence.
* Engage our social audience with tiktok, instagram content (lives, day in the life, pov etc.)
* Collaborate with the marketing team to create social media content and promote upcoming kits.
* Stay updated on baking trends and continually bring fresh ideas to the table.
* Occasionally assist with light video editing

**Qualifications:**

* A passion for baking and a positive attitude.
* Strong recipe development skills and creativity in the kitchen.
* Good on-camera presence and the ability to engage with a young audience.
* An understanding of kids’ capabilities and how to make baking accessible and fun for them.
* Light video editing and social media skills

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary.
* Flexible working hours.
* Opportunity to inspire and educate young bakers.
* A fun and positive work environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $40,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Front Desk Coordinator/Receptionist
description:
Comprehensive Medical Care is seeking a qualified candidate to fill the position of Front Desk Coordinator/Receptionist. We are a multi-specialty, outpatient rehabilitation practice located in Central New Jersey. Our office currently offers Interventional Pain Management, Regenerative Medicine, Neurology, Chiropractic Care, Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy and Acupuncture.

**Essential Job Responsibilities of a Front Desk Coordinator** 

* Organizing patient and provider schedules including patient follow-up for missed appointments.
* Clerical responsibilities including sending/receiving/filing patient medical records; communicating with local clinics to obtain lab/x-ray reports, hospital notes, referral information, etc.
* Monitoring and answering phone lines and obtaining patient information/intake and ensuring their medical benefits cover services in question
* Use practice management software to match medical provider’s availability with patient’s preferences in terms of date and time.
* Maintains scheduling system so records are accurate and complete and can be used to analyze patient/staffing patterns. Provides daily schedules to medical providers prior to each day’s visits.
* Update of the “Five Point Check-List” for evaluations, diagnostics, DME and rehabilitation and Schedule Office Hours.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Requirements for a Front Desk Coordinator:**

* Knowledge of healthcare and medical practice protocols related to scheduling appointments.
* Knowledge of medical, anatomy and physiology terminology a plus.
* Adherence to HIPAA standards.
* Knowledge of Microsoft.
* Ability to communicate effectively with physicians/clinicians about scheduling preferences.
* Excellent communication skills for both in-person interactions and phone based interactions.
* Ability to produce reports about appointment patterns as needed.

**Employee must be able to work at both locations- Edison and Monroe and must be available to work in the evenings as the facility's last patient is 7pm Monday - Thursday.**

title: Staffing Coordinator
description:
**Join Our Team as a Staffing Coordinator at Seagate Rehabilitation and Nursing Center**



Are you a dynamic, people-oriented individual with a knack for numbers? Do you have a passion for precision and a heart for healthcare? If you're someone known for your kindness, determination, and previous experience in the Skilled Nursing Facility industry, then you're exactly who we're looking for.


**Why Choose Seagate Rehabilitation and Nursing Center?**



At Seagate Rehabilitation and Nursing Center, we pride ourselves on providing top-notch healthcare services in the heart of Brooklyn, New York. As a Staffing Coordinator, you'll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on our residents' lives and be part of our team of dedicated healthcare professionals.



Salary: Up to $33/hr


**What We Offer:**


* Benefits Package: Including a 401K plan, paid time off, medical and dental plans, supplemental life, hospital, and disability plans.
* Supportive Environment: Join a team-oriented atmosphere that values your contributions and offers recognition programs.
* Career Growth: Explore opportunities for professional development and advancement within our organization.


**Responsibilities:**



As a Staffing Coordinator at Seagate Rehabilitation and Nursing Center, you will:


* Craft monthly schedules and daily assignment sheets for our nursing staff, ensuring optimal coverage.
* Assist in calculating certified hours for our nursing department, playing a crucial role in maintaining compliance.
* Collaborate with the Director of Nursing in the selection process, including interviewing, hiring, disciplining, and, when necessary, terminating CNAs, CMTs, and Nurses.
* Maintain meticulous attendance records for our dedicated nursing employees.
* Complete Payroll Change Notices for status changes such as hiring, termination, raises, full-time/part-time transitions, and leaves of absence.
* Skillfully perform reference checks on prospective nursing applicants.
* Keep a current, updated list of all clinical care employee phone numbers.
* Follow up with newly hired CNAs, CMTs, and Nurses to ensure that their checklist is complete.
* Be ready to perform other duties as requested by the Director of Nursing (DON) or Administrator.


**Requirements:**



To excel in this role, you should possess:


* A minimum of 2 year of experience as a staffing coordinator in a nursing facility.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong analytical skills.


If you're ready to embark on a rewarding career in healthcare and meet the above requirements, don't hesitate to apply today. Join Seagate Rehabilitation and Nursing Center and start making a difference in the lives of our residents. Your journey towards a fulfilling career begins here.

title: Functional Support Analyst - Oracle E-Business Suite
description:
**Overview**


The Analyst is responsible for providing business and analytical assistance in support of the maintenance, modification, and enhancement of the Oracle E-Business Suites (EBS) associated with Finance and Supply Chain functions. Modules supported by this job function include specifically, but are not limited to, Finance modules such as Project Accounting, Accounts Receivable, and General Ledger, Supply Chain modules such as Sourcing, Item Master, Supplier Master, iProcurement, Payables, Inventory and Order Management, and User Provisioning activities as needed to maintain and support Company operations. The Analyst Oracle Support, works directly with Oracle, outside consultants, and internal support staff and business users, to facilitate the implementation of multiple Oracle provided system patches and scripts associated with the aforementioned Finance and Supply Chain functions into a production environment. Specific responsibilities include execution of test scripts and review of patch and script test results prior to migration to production to insure they provide the intended result. The Analyst Oracle Support acts as a liaison between the business user, the Oracle Support Team, and Information Resources and reviews, analyzes, and triages commonly occurring system defects, enhancements, and change requests to determine potential solutions and associated work scope. The Analyst Oracle Support prepares non-complex functional design documents required to document EBS Supply Chain modifications and enhancements. All the above activities may, upon occasion, be performed under the direct or indirect supervision of a Senior Planning Analyst within the Oracle Support team.**Responsibilities**


**Core Responsibilities*** Participate in the process of implementing multiple Oracle provided system patches related to the aforementioned Finance, Supply Chain modules into production, including execution and documentation of test scenarios and scripts, performance of reviews and preparation of functional documentation necessary to insure the patches provide the intended results and system functionality.
* Work with Oracle, outside consultants, internal business users, and other Oracle Support Team resources to identify potential solutions to system issues, define functional requirements associated with proposed modifications and analyze data used in the preparation of system enhancements for the application.
* Communicate system related information, including specific functional system guidance with internal business customers
* Prepare and/or review and document non-complex functional designs for system modifications/enhancements.
* Provide daily production break/fix support.
* Support of the monthly accounting close cycle and other Company business functions.
* Execute specific test conditions and define test results for performance and user acceptance testing.
* May perform other related tasks and assignments as required.

**Qualifications**


**Required Education/Experience*** Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Information Systems, Engineering or related discipline. and minimum of two of work experience in a Finance or Supply Chain related discipline


**Preferred Education/Experience*** Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Information Systems, Engineering or related discipline. and minimum of two of work experience in a Finance or Supply Chain related discipline


**Relevant Work Experience*** Two or more years of work experience in a Finance or Supply Chain related discipline Required
* Excellent oral and written communication skills Required
* Demonstrated leadership and managerial skills Required
* Demonstrated analytic skills Required
* Ability to work in a team environment Required
* Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines Required
* Demonstrated functional knowledge of modules associated with Finance and/or Supply Chain modules of Oracle E-Business Suite. Preferred


**Skills And Abilities*** Ability to interpret basic information on drawings.
* Ability to build strong customer relationships
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Demonstrated time management and priority setting skills
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint, etc.


**Licenses And Certfications*** Driver's License Required


**Additional Physical Demands*** Must be able to respond to Company emergencies by performing a System Emergency Assignment to restore service to our customers.
* Must be able and willing to travel within Company service territory, as needed.

title: Section 8 Coordinator
description:
**Job Overview**  
Work involves assisting low-income families and individuals with securing affordable, permanent housing for eligible Section 8 households, who may include veterans, homeless, elderly, or senior citizens. The housing coordinator’s responsibilities include liaising with community organizations, government agencies, and property owners to source the means and negotiate terms that enable clients to rent suitable housing for Section 8 programs. Responsibilities includes the conducting and completing annually recertifications, interim recertifications, portability, moves, rent increases, interview applicants to determine eligibility by verifying income, assets, other financial data, and all other factors associated with implementation of the Section 8 program on a day-to-day basis in accordance with the Housing Choice Voucher (HCV) program. Other job responsibilities include scheduling recertification appointments, interface with relevant parties (i.e. contracted companies), investigate program abuse such as fraud, prepare HAP contracts, accurately enter data, and additional duties as required for program proficiency. Work is performed under general supervision of the Section 8 Administrator with latitude for independent action in carrying out work responsibilities.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Possession of a high school or equivalency diploma and either:

(A) Three (3) years’ experience in a federally or state funded community development or housing rehabilitation program; or

(B) Satisfactory completion of 30 credits at a recognized college or university\\* may be substituted for a maximum of two (2) years of the above stated experience.

( C) Bi-Lingual preferrable Spanish speaking but not required

If interested send application with resume: NaCole Newton, Section 8 Administrator

223 Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd.

White Plains, NY 10601

title: RDT (Registered Developmental Technician)
description:
**About Kinder Growth**  



At Kinder Growth we strive to support children with autism in building strong, meaningful, and enjoyable relationships with those around them. We work to support children in unlocking their potential to bring forth a happier and more engaged child.  



We take great pride in the Kinder Growth work environment. Our emphasis on employee happiness, growth, collaboration and communication are our guiding values when it comes to our staff. We recognize the value of our staff and their potential to contribute to our Kinder Growth team.  



Start your journey with us today!  


**Here’s what we’re looking for…**  



We are seeking playful and energeticRDTs to play with autistic youths. We work in the home or at school providing one to one DIRFloortime therapy sessions.
**Benefits Offered…**


* Flexible and part time hours, including evenings and weekends, with the availability to build a full time caseload.
* Career Advancement: Extensive support for those interested in advancing in an evolving field.
* Supervision: Regular direct supervision and mentoring by DIRFloortime credentialed professionals.
* Training: Meet with other RDTs under the supervision of clinical leadership for a monthly team meeting and training on various topics related to DIRFloortime.
* RDT training reimbursement
* No more than a 30 minute commute, with client-to client mileage reimbursement.
* Full time employees: Health Insurance.

  


**Here’s what your role as a** **RDT** **may look like...**  


* Work under the supervision of an AFT (Advanced Floortime Player) or QHP (Qualified Healthcare Provider).
* "Befriending" the youth.
* Playing 1:1 to support the child in development
* Video your session to reference back to when reflecting on sessions.
* Light data collection.
* Use positive, affective approaches to create meaningful change.

  


**Requirements:**
* Bachelors Degree and 1 year related experience or education (Education, Counseling, Psychology, Sociology, Developmental Intervention, RBT/ Behavior technician)
* Valid form of ID
* Pass Federal and State background checks
* Must have reliable transportation
* Ability to play on the floor
* Working device to take session data and video sessions

  


**COVID-19 Precautions:**
* Remote interview process
* Virtual meetings


**Job Types:**
* Full-time, Part-time


**Pay:**
* $25 per hour


**Education:**
* Bachelor's (required)


**Experience (1 year required):**
* Child care (babysitting, daycare, paraprofessional, preschool teacher, assistant teacher)
* Special education (educational settings, special needs)
* Developmental intervention (early intervention)
* Autism interventions (RBT/ Behavioral technician, Autism support specialist, ABA therapist, RDT, other DIRFloortime experience)


**Work Location:**
* Multiple Locations

title: Nursing Director
description:
**Nursing Director**

**Madison, NJ** 

***Sunrise Senior Living was again certified as a Great Place to Work by Activated Insights. This is the 7th time Sunrise has received this top culture and workplace designation, highlighting the special place Sunrise is to be a part of.*** 

**COMMUNITY NAME**

**Sunrise of Madison** 

Job ID: 2024-211925

JOB OVERVIEW

**Resident Care Director, RN/Director of Nursing-RN**

Sunrise, arguably the forefather of the senior housing industry has been changing people’s lives for over 45 years. We’re looking for a talented Resident Care Director, RN to join our team. At Sunrise, we strive to *champion quality life for all seniors*. Our tenure is filled with people who possess the desire and instinct to create memorable experiences for those we serve. Our principles of service guide us in assuring residents, family members and staff are afforded a life of dignity, individuality, choice, and independence.

We believe that happy employees outside of work make for more dedicated, creative, and productive employees at work. While Sunrise has been and is still known for providing exceptional care, the company is focused on hospitality and customer and employee experiences. Combining new people from outside the industry with long-standing team members, we have a recipe for success and fun! It’s an exciting time to join Sunrise.

If you’re witty, honest, experienced (with this kind of work), happy, helpful, a good dancer (okay, you don’t have to be a good dancer, but it sure wouldn’t hurt!), passionate and love to help people, then YOU are definitely the person we are looking for! Read on!

The **Resident Care Director (RCD)/Nursing Director** serves as the nursing clinical leader for the community and is responsible to lead and manage the health and wellness along with coordination of care and services to residents within the community. Responsible for oversight and implementation of all Care programs, regulatory compliance, recruiting, and performance management.

**Essential Duties**

· Inspiring Others

· Guiding Team Success

· Coaching and Developing Others

· Creating a Culture of Trust

· Leading Change

· Customer Focus

· Quality Assurance and Regulatory Compliance

· Family Service

· Driving for Results

· Business Acumen

· Financial Management

· Operational Decision Making

**Experience and Qualifications**

· 2 + years of experience as an RN; one year in home health, assisted living, or long-term care.

· 1+ years of nursing management experience to include hiring, coaching, performance management, scheduling, and daily operations supervision.

· Experience in tracking, trending, and analyzing clinical performance data preferred.

· Provide strategic leadership for resident care in the community by working with each department to coordinate care and services that promote resident’s quality of life.

· Direct management of the nursing team and medication care managers, as applicable by State/Province law, to promote the health and wellness of the resident population.

· Provide clinical care through the direct application of the nursing process; perform and document resident assessments, complete Individualized Service Plans, provide or delegate hands-on clinical care as indicated by the plan of care and evaluate resident outcomes.

· Provide oversight of the community medication management program to promote resident safety in the medication use process.

· Collaborate with physicians, pharmacists, and other clinical providers to coordinate care and services for the residents within the community.

· Provide clinical training and education as needed to nurses, medication care managers, care managers and others who provide resident care. Perform skill evaluation to develop and promote clinical capabilities of team members.

· Track, trend and report clinical quality data to identify risk. Actively participate as a member of the community Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement committee. Lead clinical quality and process improvement initiatives within the community to mitigate risk and improve resident care outcomes.

· Recruit, hire and train clinical team members and is responsible for performance management, evaluation, and engagement.

· Completes direct report team member staffing and scheduling according to operational and budgetary guidelines.

· Support regulatory compliance for the community and clinical items under their purview.

· Clinical event management and response.

**Meet Michael Juno, North Division Vice President of Operations at Sunrise**

We are excited to introduce Michael Juno as our new North Division Vice President of Operations at Sunrise. Michael brings with him 15 years of experience from his previous company, where he built a strong foundation of dedication and excellence. Although making a career change after such a long tenure was a significant decision, Michael was determined to find a workplace that resonated with his values, morals, and integrity.

Michael’s journey with Sunrise began just six months ago, and he has already been exceptionally impressed with the team and the culture. He is proud to be part of a company that aligns with his beliefs and mission. Michael is dedicated to contributing to the success of Sunrise and is passionate about the positive impact we make every day.

**Join Us at Sunrise**

We are looking for other like-minded individuals who are committed to working hard and delivering exceptional results. If you share our passion for excellence and integrity, we would love to connect with you and explore the possibilities.

Let’s talk about how you can be a part of our amazing team. Reach out to us and start a conversation today!

**Apply today to learn why Sunrise Senior Living is a certified Great Place to Work**

**PRE-EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS**

Sunrise considers the health and safety of its residents, family members, and team members to be one of its highest priorities. All offers of employment with Sunrise are conditioned on completing and passing a background check and drug test (which does not include marijuana), participating in testing requirements (e.g. Tuberculosis Test, Physical Evaluation). Covid-19 and Influenza vaccination is only required to the extent mandated by applicable federal, state, and local laws and authorities.

**COMPENSATION DISCLAIMER:**

Selected candidates will be offered competitive compensation based on geographic location of community/office, skills, experience, qualifications, and certifications/licenses (where applicable).

**SEARCH FIRM REPRESENTATIVES PLEASE READ CAREFULLY:**

Sunrise Senior Living is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for this employment opportunity. Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to Sunrise Senior Living by any means, be it via email, the Internet or directly to hiring managers at Sunrise Senior Living in any form without a valid written search agreement in place for that position will be deemed the property of Sunrise Senior Living, and no fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by Sunrise Senior Living as a result of such unsolicited referral or through any other means.

Equal Opportunity Employer
