title: Field Auto Adjuster - Philadelphia, PA
description:
At Allstate, great things happen when our people work together to protect families and their belongings from life’s uncertainties. And for more than 90 years our innovative drive has kept us a step ahead of our customers’ evolving needs. From advocating for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws, to being an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, and, more recently, device and identity protection.

**Job Description**


A day in the life of the Field Auto Damage Adjuster, and what it takes to do the job!  

  

As a Field Auto Adjuster, you will play a crucial role in our Auto claims handling process by writing estimates directly at customer homes, repair shops, or tow yards. Your job will involve a variety of customer/shop interactions, including face-to-face, virtual, and written communication, as you assess and finalize estimates. With a diverse range of workstreams, including repairable estimates, total loss assessments, and virtual inspections, you will enjoy a dynamic and engaging work environment. You must live in Philadelphia/Camden, PA /NJ area to be eligible for this role.  

  

  

As a Field Auto Adjuster, you will play a crucial role in our Auto claims handling process by writing estimates directly at customer homes, repair shops, or tow yards. Your job will involve a variety of customer/shop interactions, including face-to-face, virtual, and written communication, as you assess and finalize estimates. With a diverse range of workstreams, including repairable estimates, total loss assessments, and virtual inspections, you will enjoy a dynamic and engaging work environment. You must live in the Philadelphia, PA/Camden, NJ area to be eligible for this role.**You’ll wear a few hats to fill a few roles throughout your day that all require a level of experience.**

 **The Customer Service Expert –** you’ll live into Allstate’s Claims Culture by caring, empowering, and restoring, and you will accomplish that by being compassionate, clear, and a committed partner in each Casualty claim. You lead with empathy, always.

 **The Investigator –** you’ll confidently and independently investigate casualty (and applicable LOB (line of business)) claims by performing detailed reviews of damage and interpreting policies to determine coverage.

 **The Effective Communicator –** you’ll use phone, emails and sometimes even video chat with customers to help them through a fast, fair, and easy claims process. You’ll also incorporate a specific approach to claim handling to offer the customer their preference of communication to efficiently discuss their claim needs and keep them updated on the claim progress.

 **The Negotiator –** You will evaluate and negotiate claims settlements with customers, vendors, third party carriers and claimants, in accordance with all legal and business standard methodologies. With negotiations, you will incorporate tactics in handling challenging and complex situations.

 **The Problem Solver –** You’ll utilize multiple tools to get the job done in a fast-paced environment, including estimate tools, job aids, and additional settlement platforms, all while using your sharp critical thinking skills.

 **The Recorder –** You’ll protect the company financially by executing policies along policy agreements, and you keep a clear record of your work in a claims system that you will be trained on. You’ll accomplish this by ensuring timely and accurate documentation is completed as you work on each claim.

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

* You have 18 months+ experience in auto Collision estimating using CCC or Mitchell.
* Proficient written and verbal communication skills to effectively interact with customers.
* Strong attention to detail and ability to write precise and comprehensive estimates.
* Comfortable with utilizing technology and various platforms for claims processing.
* Excellent time management and organizational skills to manage multiple assignments effectively.
* Valid driver's license and willingness to travel as part of the job requirements.

*Notice of Licensing Requirement:*

* As a condition of employment, your office/area may require you to obtain an adjuster and/or an appraiser license. If applicable, you will be required to secure license(s) within 60 days of hire.
* If required, the Hiring Manager will work with you along with the Centralized Licensing team to ensure that you are properly licensed.

 **Licensing Bonus:**


This is not an entry level position. Candidates must have experience writing auto collision estimates using auto estimating programs such as: CCC One, Audatex, or Mitchell

 *You may be eligible for a $1000 Licensing bonus if you have the applicable active licenses needed for this role. This could include Home Resident Property & Casualty License, Designated Home State (DHS) Florida or Texas License, and/or applicable Appraiser License.*

*\\*\\*Candidates who have previously worked for and are seeking to be rehired at Allstate and its family of companies are not eligible for this sign-on bonus.\\*\\**

 **Allstate Benefits:**


Being a part of Allstate means you receive a benefits package from Day 1 of employment. This includes time off, healthcare, retirement, and more. That is why as an Allstater, you’ll enjoy a Total Rewards package that includes:

* Competitive pay with needed support for continuous development and career advancement.
* Flexibility in scheduling and a time off policy that helps support your work/life balance.
* Initial and ongoing training to get you proficient in your new role
* Comprehensive benefits like a 401K/pension, education reimbursement, and programs to help you balance work with the rest of your life. Visit www.allstategoodlife.com to learn more. #LI-MH1

 *Company Car:* Based on our Company Car Guidelines, this role may qualify for a company car. Our leadership team determines this based on annual work mileage for this location. You may be required to use your personal vehicle until these guidelines are met. We offer mileage reimbursements for personal vehicle usage during work.

  

Notes: The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities. May be required to perform other related duties as assigned. Regular, predictable attendance is an essential function of this job.

 **Please note, you may be required to attend 1-week of training that will take place in Wheeling, IL.**

  

This position is not available for Puerto Rico, California, Alaska, and Hawaii residents.

**Skills**


Customer Centricity, Digital Literacy, Inclusive Leadership, Learning Agility, Results-Oriented**Compensation**


Compensation offered for this role is $52,260.00 - 92,790.00 annually and is based on experience and qualifications.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.


Joining our team isn’t just a job — it’s an opportunity. One that takes your skills and pushes them to the next level. One that encourages you to challenge the status quo. And one where you can impact the future for the greater good.


You’ll do all this in a flexible environment that embraces connection and belonging. And with the recognition of several inclusivity and diversity awards, we’ve proven that Allstate empowers everyone to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live.

**Good Hands. Greater Together.**


Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.

title: Roadside Assistance Technician
description:
## Overview  
We are seeking a skilled Technician to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience with power tools, hand tools, mechanical knowledge, and possess the ability to perform roadside assistance.

## Duties  
- Must know how to do tire changes ,lock outs , battery replacements ,tire plugs & more

## Skills  
- Proficiency in using power tools and hand tools  
- floor jack (ton)

-lock outs

-jump starts

-battery replacements

- tire Plugs

-Must have valid driver license with one year + of experience.

**LOVE TO HELP OTHERS LOOK AND FEEL GORGEOUS? JOIN OUR TEAM AT EUROPEAN WAX CENTER WEST BABYLON!**

Are you passionate about people and beauty? Are you naturally confident and outgoing? Does the idea of earning excellent commission drive you? If so, you need to join our team!

Turn your passion into a rewarding role with our growing team at European Wax Center, West Babylon! We're in the business of Revealing Beautiful Skin, and with your help, we'll give guests a reason to walk in, and strut out.

***Here’s why you should come work with us:***

* We believe that happy employees make happy guests, so you can expect a fun, upbeat, flexible work environment.

* We believe in promoting from within, so you’ll have opportunities for advancement.

An upbeat attitude & committed to delighting our guests and—of course—having fun while being awesome!

Educating guests on the benefits of waxing and our wax packages.

Scheduling and confirming appointments and managing guest flow throughout the day.

Ability to work in a fun, fast-paced environment.

Ability to work a flexible schedule including nights and weekends, because that’s when we’re busy.

As a Guest Service/Sales Associate, you'll have the drive and dedication to hit the ground running. Our comprehensive training will provide you with all the tools you will need and to show our appreciation, we offer great pay and performance incentives throughout your career!

Complimentary unlimited brow waxing, as well as discounts on all other services & retail products.

A fun, well-managed, successful work environment.

Hourly wage plus commissions & bonuses

Flexible schedule – full and part-time.

Career growth.

This role is perfect for those looking for full time and part-time opportunities. We are open 7 days a week and offer flexible shifts.

title: School Nurse
description:
**NEWARK BOARD OF EDUCATION**  

**HUMAN RESOURCE SERVICES**  

**765 BROAD STREET, NEWARK, NEW JERSEY 07102**  

**ROGER LEÓN, DISTRICT SUPERINTENDENT**

  


**School Nurse**



Office of Health Services  

(Pending availability of funds and Board of Education approval)

  


The Superintendent invites qualified and interested persons to apply for the position of School Nurse within the Office of Health Services.

  


**Qualifications**



* Bachelor's degree.


* Current RN License.


* Preferred Minimum of five (5) years successful experience as a registered nurse.


* Preferred Possession of a NJ School Nurse Certificate but must minimally possess a Non-Instructional School Nursing Certificate with enrollment in a program to obtain the Instructional Certificate.


* Possession of a valid NJ Driver’s License, only if the operation of a vehicle rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essential duties of the position.


* Bilingual and able to read, write and speak English. Spanish/ Portuguese/ French Creole is a plus



Note: The examples of work for this title are for illustrative purposes only. A particular position using this title may not be performed all duties listed in this job specification. Conversely, all duties performed on the job may not be listed.


**Responsibilities**



1. Develops a comprehensive health record on each new student that registers for school including an appropriate health history. The information contained therein includes identification data, pre-natal, neo-natal and early development history; disease experiences; social and family history of parents and siblings; immunization data in accordance with the requirements of the State of New Jersey; and notes and advice or referrals discussed with the parent/guardian.



2. Performs routine screenings of vision and hearing, weighing and measuring, and blood pressure and visual dental check. When deviation from the norm is detected, the certified school nurse is responsible for referring the student and parent to the appropriate practitioner or agency for follow-up, and documenting such activities.



3. Interprets the findings of the physical examination to parents, teacher and child (on his level) to motivate the student to take an interest and develop a responsibility for his own health. Where physical defects are detected, assists the parent in contacting the available professional resources for diagnosis and treatment.



4. Provides emergency medical care for all employees and arranges for care and follow-up at an appropriate emergency room or at the facility designated by the district.



5. Counsels parents, teachers and students concerning medical and health related information. Instructs teaches and other staff regarding ‘the signs and symptoms of diseases of individual students that would indicate that they need immediate health services.



6. Conducts tuberculin screening programs on staff and students as mandated by the New Jersey State Department of Health and Education.



7. Reviews every medical record annually to provide information to parents and administration concerning the immunization status of all school students as is required by law.



8. Provide input into health education programs by being the health resource person in the school. The certified school nurse may actively participate in the health and in-service educational instruction for students and their parents.



9. Informs and interprets for the child study team all medical and or other findings on the NPS children that will enable them to better understand the child in order that he may be properly placed and attain a level of achievement consistent with his abilities.



10. Assists in planning and maintaining a safe and healthful school environment.



11. Confers with representatives of community agencies in matters pertaining to family and community health.



12. Dispenses medication prescribed by a physician in keeping with the current guidelines set forth by the Medical Director. Provides nursing care as deemed necessary by the child’s health condition.



13. Serves on various committees within the school as is deemed necessary.



14. Administers prescribed treatments and ensures that prescribed measures are carried out.



15. May be requested to fulfill any nursing function within the scope and practice of the New Jersey Nurse Practice Act.



16. Performs related duties as assigned.



17. Performs other duties consistent with specific contractual terms of employment as assigned by the Director or designee.


**Reports To**  

Executive Director of Health Services  

  

**Salary, Terms & Affiliation**



* Salary Range $47,175 - $106,010


* Union Affiliation: Newark Teachers Association (NTA)


* Employment Period: Ten months
  

  

**How To Apply**  

Newark Board of Education only accepts electronic applications.



Apply to full application through Frontline: https://www.applitrack.com/npsnj/onlineapp/\\_application.aspx?posJobCodes=422&posFirstChoice=Instructional%20-%20Other%20Titles&posSpecialty=Nurse  

  

**Open and Close Dates**  

OPENING DATE: 7/20/2023  

CLOSING DATE: Until filled  

  

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


**THE NEWARK BOARD OF EDUCATION IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER**

title: Medical Biller/Receptionist
description:
**Full Job Description**

Our pediatric ophthalmology practice located in Livingston, NJ, specializes in strabismus. We are a family-owned practice with a high-performing team that values kindness and inclusivity. We are seeking an experienced Billing Specialist to join our team as a Biller/Receptionist with estimated split of 50% in each area.

**Billing Responsibilities (50%):**

* Posting charges (CPT-4; ICD-10) & submitting insurance claims
* Posting EOBs, including adjustments
* Working AR including denials and appeals
* Posting patient payments
* Review physician's coding for accuracy
* Verifying medical insurance eligibility on Availity
* Sending patient bills
* Collect co-pays
* Other duties as assigned

**Reception Responsibilities (50%):**

* Collect co-pays
* Schedule appointments
* Review patient demographics in Practice Management System
* Maintain complete and accurate records and files
* Print and distribute schedules
* Greet/admit patients for their appointments
* Answer the phone/reply to email
* Prepare patient charts with appropriate forms
* Collect fees when appropriate
* Assist patients with forms
* Other duties as assigned

**Qualifications:**

* Knowledge of and prior experience in ophthalmology billing CPT, ICD-10, modifiers
* Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to confidently speak to patients
* Excellent organizational skills to manage multiple tasks throughout the day
* Ability to communicate and work well with others in the office

Knowledge of Medical insurance, coding (CPT-4, ICD-10, modifiers) and HIPAA is required. Should be proficient working with commercial insurance. Experience with Availityand Cigna for Health Care Professionals is helpful. The job focus is on billing not coding. Experience with STI’s Practice Manager software is a major plus.

Candidate should possess strong customer service skills, be professional and organized. Ability to multitask required. Must know MS Office and be able to use an EMR. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, 401K, PTO, and paid holidays.

title: Director of Engineering Standards
description:
**About Us**

Solar Landscape is the leading commercial and community solar developer in the United States.

We partner with the world's largest real estate companies to develop, install, and operate solar projects on commercial and industrial rooftops. Through our groundbreaking community solar model, households in surrounding communities can subscribe to receive solar power at a guaranteed discount.

To date, Solar Landscape has deployed over 500 megawatts of renewable energy projects totaling over $1 billion in capital investment. Solar Landscape was named the #1 Distributed Generation developer for 2023 by New Project Media and was awarded the U.S. Department of Energy’s Equitable Community Solar Grand Prize.  

We reinvest in our communities as a leading provider of solar PPAs to municipalities, schools, and universities, as well as through our award-winning solar workforce development program.  

Solar Landscape is growing fast. Doubling in size year after year, we are looking for the best and brightest to drive our next phase of growth. We’re made up of thought leaders, thinkers, dreamers, doers. We are insightful, driven, rebellious, fun, and we are better together. Our diverse and unique backgrounds are all given a voice and seat at the table to help make real change for the communities we serve.

For more about Solar Landscape, visit www.solarlandscape.com.
**About The Role**  

The Director of Engineering Standards will be responsible for establishing and managing the company's engineering standards, specifications, and best practices to ensure high-quality project execution. This role will collaborate with various cross-functional teams to create, evaluate, and continuously improve processes across project phases—from design through commissioning. The Director will also oversee quality control, lead training initiatives, and act as a technical expert, advising stakeholders on complex engineering issues.
### **Responsibilities**

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and document streamlined processes for project engineering, from initial design to commissioning.
* Continuously evaluate existing processes, identify bottlenecks, and propose improvements to enhance efficiency.
* Develop comprehensive SOPs for various project phases, including site assessment, engineering design, electrical equipment selection, construction, and commissioning.
* Ensure adherence to SOPs across all teams and provide training as needed.
* Develop, manage and keep updated all the specifications, technical templates, standards and best practices for the company to ensure high quality throughput for the firm’s work.
* Develop and implement quality control processes to maintain the highest standards in system design, installation, and performance.
* Engage and onboard third-party engineering firms to work with Project Engineers on project execution.
* Collaborate with the technology team to maintain and improve the Operations business applications platform.
* Evaluate site layouts and optimize designs at project award to consider constructability and project cost, provide direction to Project Engineers to execute
* Conduct technology reviews of new products and service offerings to provide the company with a competitive advantage.
* Act as the Company’s technical expert and advise management, project managers, and project engineers on complex engineering topics.
* Work with Project Management Leads to optimize project resource planning, scheduling, and resource allocation.
* Ensure timely completion of milestones and deliverables across all engineering teams within operations.
* Collaborate with Project Management Leads and HR to recruit, train, and onboard new team members.
* Foster a positive work environment that encourages teamwork and productivity.
* Define key performance indicators (KPIs) for project engineering teams.
* Generate regular reports on department progress, resource utilization, and performance against targets.
* Build a trust and rapport with all Solar Landscape departments.

### **Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, or related field of study preferred.
* 10+ years project management experience and/or engineering background in Solar.
* Familiarity with solar energy systems, EPC best practices, quality, and safety protocols.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office suite, Dynamics 365 (or other construction management software), AutoCAD, PVSYST, Adobe Acrobat Pro or equivalent pdf editor
* Strong leadership skills and the ability to motivate and guide teams.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Excellent problem-solving abilities.
* Organization and communication skills.
* Detail-oriented, self-starter.
* Professional engineering license (PE) preferred.
* Valid Driver’s License, occasional travel to various job sites required.

**Benefits and Perks**

Solar Landscape’s company culture is second to none.
Our employees combine our mission, grit and drive with a rebel’s attitude that is changing the industry:* Located in the heart of historic Asbury Park, our state-of-the-art office space offers flexible workstations encouraging collaboration and movement.
* Employees come together to eat every day! Like in a home, our gourmet kitchen is the heart of the office. Solar Landscape has a full-time in-house chef cooking daily farm-to-table meals using locally sourced organic food.
* Also included in employees is our competitive compensation package; a 401(k) employer-match; health, dental, & vision insurance, flexible paid time off and holiday PTO; We provide healthy snacks, coffee, volunteer opportunities, company outings, and more!

description:
\\*Job Overview\\* We are looking for a passionate and dedicated Preschool Teacher to join our team. As a Preschool Teacher, you will play a crucial role in creating a nurturing and stimulating environment for young children to learn and grow. \\*Responsibilities\\* - Develop and implement age-appropriate lesson plans that promote educational development - Provide engaging instruction in various subjects including literacy, math, and social skills - Manage classroom activities and ensure a safe and supportive learning environment - Monitor and assess individual student progress, adjusting teaching strategies as needed - Collaborate with colleagues and parents to support the holistic development of each child - Utilize effective classroom management techniques to foster a positive learning atmosphere - Incorporate Montessori or other educational methodologies to enhance learning experiences \\*Experience\\* - Prior experience in classroom teaching, tutoring, or daycare settings - Strong understanding of childhood development principles - Familiarity with special education practices is a plus - Excellent communication skills to interact effectively with students, parents, and colleagues - Proficiency in math education to support early numeracy skills If you are enthusiastic about early childhood education, possess excellent communication skills, and have a passion for fostering young learners' growth, we encourage you to apply for the Preschool Teacher position.

Application Question(s):

* At the start of many classes, students are still out of their seats and unfocused. They also pack up early and wait by the door before you've finished for the day.

What would you do?  
A. Establish a routine with assignments at the beginning and end of class  
B. Tell students they can pack up a few minutes early if they are on time  
C. Assign lunch detention to any student who is out of their seat during class time  
D. Praise and reward the students who are in their seats and ready to work each day  
E. Give bonus points to any student who heads to their seat without being redirected

* You're sitting with two children who are playing with manipulatives. The boy holds up his creation and says, "I made a bird!" The girl says, "That's not a bird."

What would you do?  
A. Say, "It can be a bird! He's using his imagination!"  
B. Tell the girl, "Don't be mean; he did his best."  
C. Suggest that the boy add features to make it look more like a bird  
D. Show the children how to make a bird  
E. Ask the girl to demonstrate how to make a bird

* You're asking your class to participate in role plays and debates.

What type of engagement technique are you using?  
A. Active learning  
B. Gamification  
C. Inquiry-based learning  
D. Differentiated instruction  
E. Think-Pair-Share

title: Personal Injury Paralegal
description:
About Us

Meirowitz & Wasserberg, LLP, is a mid-size trial law firm that is dedicated to fighting for injured people with offices located in NY, NJ, PA, NC, IL, FL, and TX. We represent people, not corporations. Join our team to help injured folks get the justice they deserve.

About the Role

We are seeking an experienced Plaintiff's Personal Injury Paralegal to join our legal team in our new Hackensack, NJ office. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years of experience in Plaintiff's Personal Injury cases and be familiar with the legal procedures in New York. The paralegal will play a crucial role in assisting our attorneys in all aspects of personal injury cases. This position will be based full-time in office.

You Will:

· Order and review medical records and other relevant documents and summarize them for attorney review.

· Conduct initial client interviews and gather relevant case information while maintaining clear and organized client files.

· Prepare and file complaints, petitions, and other legal documents.

· Complete and submit necessary No-Fault paperwork and applications.

· Draft Bills of Particulars and Settlement Demand packages.

· Handle all case e-filing and CMO calendar management.

· Communicate regularly with clients to provide case updates.

You Have:

· Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Plaintiff's Personal Injury Paralegal in New Jersey.

· Strong understanding of personal injury case procedures, including pre-suit and litigation.

· Familiarity with e-filing on NJ E-Courts.

Nice to Have:

· Experience e-filing on PACER.

· *Strongly Preferred: Bilingual in Spanish and English.*

Our Benefits:

· Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Plans

· Paid Time Off

· Commuter Transit Program

· Retirement Plan

Salary Range: $26-$36.50 per hour

The quoted salary range represents our good faith estimate as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate's experience, industry knowledge, location, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $24.00 - $34.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Experience:

* NJ E-Courts: 1 year (Required)
* pre-suit: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Director of Product Led Growth
description:
**LOCATION: New York, NY or San Francisco, CA**


**Conductor** is a leading Website Optimization & Intelligence platform. Today's top brands use Conductor to create and optimize digital experiences that get found organically in search engines and drive value for customers. The platform provides actionable SEO, content, and technical website intelligence paired with real-time website monitoring to help customers accelerate—and protect—digital growth.


**Conductor** is a mission-driven company with a commitment to innovation, customer success, and culture. For Conductor, success is improving the lives of all the people in our orbit—our customers, our customers' customers, our employee-owners, and our communities.



We are seeking a **Director, Product Led Growth** to join our team and lead our efforts in driving customer acquisition, activation, conversion, and upsell/cross sell through the optimization of our product-led growth (PLG) efforts. In this role, you will be responsible for leading a highly cross functional team developing and executing initiatives that increase the efficiency and effectiveness of our entire product led customer acquisition life cycle.



Responsibilities:


* Develop and execute a comprehensive PLG strategy as part of a broader hybrid GTM motion that drives customer acquisition, activation, conversion, and upsell/cross sell opportunities
* Formulate, test and optimize pricing and packaging strategies that drives in product conversion
* Lead a cross functional team developing and executing product led initiatives across the entire customer life cycle, from acquisition to retention
* Work closely with the product, UX and engineering teams to identify and prioritize features that will drive customer acquisition, activation and conversion in product
* Identify opportunities to optimize land and expand synergies with direct sales motion
* Partner with the marketing, sales and customer success teams to develop effective campaigns that support customer acquisition and retention goals.
* Analyze user behavior and customer feedback to develop data-driven hypotheses for improving product acquisition and activation
* Continuously measure and optimize PLG initiatives and campaigns through testing and data analysis.
* Work with a diverse PLG tech stack including Heap, Pendo, Intercom, Marketo, Catalyst and internal customer data platforms

  

  

Qualifications:


* 8+ years of experience in growth marketing and/or product management roles, with a strong focus on PLG, PLS and growth initiatives
* Strong exposure and PLG experiences in B2B enterprise SaaS companies, ideally alongside a hybrid GTM motion that includes direct enterprise sales
* Experience leading high-performing cross functional growth teams
* Strong understanding of self service customer acquisition and conversion strategies, including in product activation, onboarding, and upsell/cross
* Demonstrated success in improving product adoption and retention through data-driven hypothesis testing
* Strong analytical data skills and experience using data to inform decision-making.
* Experience working with product, UX and engineering teams to develop and prioritize features that drive customer engagement and retention.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across diverse functions and teams
* Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, computer science/technology, or related field. Master's degree preferred
* Experience working in a B2B SaaS company required
* Website Technology and/or Digital Marketing experience a plus


-



Compensation: Conductor maintains competitive, performance-based compensation programs.


**The NYC base salary range for this role is currently $175,000 - $220,000.** Actual base salary offered may vary within this range based on education, knowledge, skills, abilities, relevant experience, internal equity, and geographic location, among other factors. The actual compensation, if offered a position, will be based on these factors.


**Variable compensation:** In addition to the base salary, this role is also eligible for a 20% corporate bonus.



-



Conductor LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Bringing in diverse perspectives and challenging our assumptions is the clear key to growth; it drives innovation, creativity, faster problem-solving, and stronger decision making. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, train, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs*.*



Conductor does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, or other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance. In addition, it is the policy of Conductor to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified employees who have protected disabilities to the extent required by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances where a particular employee works.

title: Vice President Event Management
description:
Church Pension Group (CPG) is a financial services organization located in Midtown Manhattan. CPG was founded in 1917 to provide pension benefits to eligible clergy of the Episcopal Church. Since then, its mission has expanded to include life and disability insurance, health benefits, property & casualty insurance, and publishing.  


The Event Management Group (EMG) collaborates across CPG to set standards and coordinate invitations, registrations, hospitality, and logistics for in-person and virtual events hosted by CPG so that all invitees and attendees experience CPG’s high levels of professionalism, trustworthiness, and compassion.

The **Vice President Event Management** reports to the EVP, Chief Communications Officer and provides strategic direction and oversight of the teams accountable for the logistics, hospitality, event planning, and production for all in-person, CEO, corporate, board and virtual events for both clients and CPG employees from event design through closure. This positiondevelops and manages event strategy and execution consistent with CPG’s strategic plan, annual corporate and business unit objectives, and an ongoing commitment to strong financial stewardship.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:** Include the following. Other duties may be assigned:
* Leverage event management expertise to direct and influence all CPG events (internal and external, live and virtual)
* Manage the teams responsible for in-person and virtual events including in-house catering and events.
* Identify and manage events-related vendors
* Partner with colleagues at all levels to align on annual event plans and specific event strategies
* Provide critical input to annual events or conference budgets owned by others
* Develop, manage and maintain EMG’s budget
* Collaborate with colleagues to publish an annual calendar of CPG events
* Leverage key learnings from post event surveys and other feedback with team to drive continuous improvement
* Ensure EMG policies, procedures, and standards are developed and maintained
* Effective performance of the essential functions of this position requires regular in-person, on-site interaction with colleagues, both for purposes of relationship building and meaningful collaboration


**QUALIFICATIONS:** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
* Exemplary leadership, staff coaching and team development skills with a strong executive presence
* Ability to work effectively and collaboratively among cross-functional teams
* An understanding of CPG’s clients, or familiarity with a similar client base, and what typical event needs will be
* Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills
* Technical skills, especially in event management-related technologies (Cvent, ZOOM)
* Strong financial management capability
* Vendor management experience with national and local vendors
* Ability to align on strategic vision and execute corporate goals and initiatives
* Ability to make broad ranging & sound decisions with limited information & time
* Strong creative problem solving and innovation skills with experience delivering results
* Logical thinker who can quickly correct situations when they occur, excellent problem-solving skills
* Highly effective verbal / written communication skills
* Ability to manage executive requests and expectations


**EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:**

* 10+ years of relevant business experience
* Bachelor's Degree or relevant work experience required; MBA/post graduate degree preferred

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**
Commuting to the NY office, on average, three days a week. Extensive use of a computer keyboard is a demand of the position to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable someone with a disability to perform the essential functions of this position.**WORK ENVIRONMENT**
Hybrid (two days working from home, three days working in a standard office environment). Church Pension Group employees must maintain a professional, compassionate, and trustworthy work environment always. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable someone with a disability to perform the essential functions of the job within this environment.

Salary Range: $190,000 - $210,000*Join us and Create A Better Future For Yourself!*

  

Flexible Benefits available to eligible employees:

* Medical (including Vision)
* Dental
* Supplemental Dental


 Core Benefits automatically provided to eligible employees:

* Employer funded defined benefit pension plan (five year vesting)
* Employee Life Insurance
* Spouse and Dependent Life Insurance
* Accidental Death and Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance
* Short-Term Disability (STD) coverage
* Long-Term Disability (LTD) coverage (elected as either pre-tax or after-tax)
* Business Travel Accident Insurance
* Worker’s Compensation
* Employee Assistance Program
* Retiree health insurance (eligible after 10 years)
* Retiree life insurance


Elective Benefits available to eligible employees:

* 401(k) with matching contributions (immediate vesting)
* Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)
* Commuter Benefits
* New York’s 529 College Savings Program (NY State residents)


Educational Assistance Program available to eligible employees


Maternity/Paternity Leave available to eligible employees


Time Off available to eligible employees: Vacation, Sick, Personal and Holidays


 In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. Please understand that, as a general policy, CPG does not sponsor visas.

  

EOE: Minorities/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation  

If you are a CPG employee, please use your CPG email address when creating your profile to apply.

title: Director, Human Resources
description:
**Overview**  
We are looking for a dedicated and strategic Director of Human Resources to lead our HR department. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in overseeing all HR practices and processes, ensuring compliance with regulations, and implementing HR strategies to align with organizational objectives.

**Duties**

* Translate organization strategy into a people strategy that most effectively actualizes the company’s mission, vision, & values.
* Become a trusted strategic partner within the company; maintain strong and positive working relationships in collaboration with senior leaders and staff at all levels throughout the organization.
* Participate as a strategic partner in the development of plans and programs, particularly from the perspective of impact on people; advise on programs that will improve on attracting, motivating, developing, and retaining talented team members.
* Ensure the company handbook reflects the policies, procedures, working conditions, and behavioral expectations that guide employees.
* Identify and understand key business drivers and ensure effective HR initiatives and solutions are delivered to complement and enhance the performance of the business.
* Develop resourcing strategies and actions that support timely and efficient scaling of the business including identifying talent within and outside the Company.
* Enhance talent management programs, including individual, team, and management training and development; lead evaluation, selection, and introduction of systems to manage and develop employees at all levels in the organization and ensure delivery of appropriate training programs; work with senior leadership to implement consistent company-wide career bands and growth ladders so that team members are always appropriately challenged and motivated.
* Create robust SOPs, onboarding, and orientation programs for new hires to ensure a smooth and positive integration experience for each new employee.
* Monitor and report on market trends in pay, benefits, and rewards structures; develop and enhance progressive and proactive compensation & benefits programs to provide motivation, incentives, and support for top performers, contributors to a healthy & positive culture, and champions of the mission, vision, and values.
* Develop, implement, and support programs to promote sustainable diversity, equity, and inclusion within the employee population.
* Develop, enhance, and maintain effective employee communication channels, including employee engagement and feedback measurement.
* Serve as an effective resource to resolve personnel-related and professional relationship work issues; when needed, provide case decisions and appropriate corrective actions.
* Facilitate personnel effectiveness across various groups, employees, and the HR team.
* Counsel, coach, and guide managers and staff in addressing concerns and complaints to assure fair and equitable treatment while ensuring compliance with labor regulations and practices; manage investigations and workers’ compensation claims.
* Regularly challenge the status quo of the HR service and identify and implement continuous process improvements across all HR activities; utilize HR KPIs and dashboards to demonstrate current status against targets and support decision-making.
* Oversee payroll, timekeeping, and government-mandated benefits; draft announcements/memos in compliance with company policies and due process requirements; ensure that any risks associated with the HR function with respect to current and future legislation are communicated and managed appropriately and effectively.
* Partner with Legal to develop and administer employee compliance-related initiatives.

**Experience**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources or related field; Master's degree preferred.
* Proven experience as an HR Director or in a similar senior HR role.
* Deep understanding of labor laws and HR best practices.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to supervise effectively.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication abilities.
* Proficiency in conflict management and resolution techniques.
* Familiarity with data analysis for informed decision-making.

If you are a visionary leader passionate about enhancing organizational success through effective human resources management, we encourage you to apply for this challenging yet fulfilling position.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Ability to Relocate:

* Hempstead, NY: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: School Based Mental Health Clinician
description:
**About us**

Wellspring Center for Prevention is a private nonprofit agency serving the community members and organizations of Middlesex and Monmouth Counties. We are dedicated to improving the health and well-being of individuals, families, and communities through our quality prevention and early intervention services. Our programs promote sound mental health, effective family functioning, and awareness of the devastating effects of substance misuse and dependency.

\\*Overview\\*

We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate School-Based Mental Health Clinician to join our team in providing high-quality mental health services to middle school students. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in supporting the emotional, behavioral, and social well-being of students, helping them to thrive academically and personally.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Individual and Group Counseling:** Provide individual and group therapy sessions to middle school students, addressing a wide range of mental health issues such as anxiety, depression, trauma, peer relationships, and behavioral challenges.
* **Crisis Intervention:** Respond to mental health crises within the school, providing immediate support and working with school staff and families to develop crisis management plans.
* **Assessment and Treatment Planning:** Conduct comprehensive mental health assessments, develop individualized treatment plans, and monitor progress toward therapeutic goals.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with teachers, school counselors, administrators, and parents to create a supportive environment that promotes the mental health and well-being of students.
* **Consultation:** Offer consultation and training to school staff on mental health topics, including identifying students in need of support and implementing classroom strategies to support student wellness.
* **Prevention Education:** Develop and deliver prevention education programs on topics such as bullying, substance abuse, stress management, and healthy relationships. Collaborate with school staff to integrate these programs into the school curriculum and promote a culture of wellness.
* **Case Management:** Coordinate care with external providers, including psychiatrists, community mental health agencies, and social services, to ensure continuity of care for students.
* **Documentation:** Maintain accurate and confidential records of all services provided, ensuring compliance with state and federal regulations.

title: Cleaner (Croton Heights at Park Vista)
description:
WinnCompanies is looking for a dependable and customer service-oriented **Cleaner** to join our Croton Heights at Park Vista team, a 60-unit affordable housing community. You will also assist 149 units at the two neighboring properties within walking distance located in **Yonkers, NY.**  

In this role, you will perform cleaning functions to ensure the appearance and physical condition of the property is maintained to ownership and management expectations.  

This opportunity offers a typical work schedule: Monday through Friday 8am - 5pm. This position offers a pay range of $18 - $19 per hour.
### **Responsibilities**

* Perform day-to-day tasks, which include, but are not limited to: cleaning office, windows, walls, floors, stairwells, laundry rooms, bathrooms, common areas, hallways, elevators, carpets and painting as requested.
* Empty trash cans, sweep sidewalks, set up hoses, rake lawns and flower beds, plant flowers, and install mulch.
* Prepare all trash and recycling, including bulk items, for removal by city sanitation.
* Perform each cleaning function in accordance with the property's prescribed daily schedule.
* Clean vacant units.
* Perform other cleaning functions as assigned by supervisor.

### **Requirements**

* Less than 1 year of cleaning or porter work experience.
* Ability to understand spoken and written English.
* Ability to respond to requests in a timely and respectful manner.
* Excellent customer service skills.
* Ability to work with a diverse group of people and personalities.
* Prior experience using floor scrubbers and buffers.
* Ability to do heavy lifting and other physical movements, including, but not limited to: standing/walking, repetitive use of hands, climbing, reaching, stooping, kneeling, etc.

### **Preferred Qualifications**

* High school diploma or GED equivalent.
* Bilingual in English and Spanish.
* Experience with a trash compactor.


Please visit our website: https://www.livecrotonheights.com/ **Our Benefits:**
Permanent full-time US employees are eligible to participate in the following benefits:* Generous time off policies (including 11 paid holidays (12 for MA employees); Generous Accrued Time Off increasing with years of service; Generous paid sick time; Annual day of service; Floating Holiday)
* 401(k) plan options with a company match

* Long Term Disability and voluntary Short Term Disability; Basic Term Life Insurance and AD&D; optional supplemental life insurance

* Wellbeing program (group challenges, seminars, opportunities to earn points to reduce medical premiums), Employee Assistance Program, & Commuter and Parking Reimbursement options

* Flexible and/or Hybrid schedules are available for certain roles
* Employee Relief Program supporting employees with unexpected hardships that place undue financial stress on them and their families
* To learn more, visit winnbenefits.com

 **Why WinnCompanies?*****A job you can be proud of*****:** WinnCompanies is a nationally recognized leader in apartment community management and development. Through our recognition and rewards programs, we’re committed to celebrating and uplifting our team members.

title: Friendly Medication delivery Routes Drivers Needed
description:
**Make a difference with every delivery**  
Build your own schedule, bring prescriptions to customers in a timely manner, and get paid every week. Delivering for Dragonfly is a better way to drive, and an easy way to earn.  
**Why drive with Dragonfly?**  
**Flexibility**  
Choose your own hours to build a work schedule that fits into your life.  
**Reliability**  
With guaranteed pay for every shift, there’s no secret to maximizing earnings.  
**Impact**  
Each delivery you make is critical to many customers’ health and to our mission.  
**To drive with Dragonfly, you’ll need:**

* To be at least 18 years old
* A valid driver’s license
* Authorization to work in the U.S.
* Access to a reliable vehicle with climate control
* Insurance and valid registration

**FAQs**  
**Do couriers drive their own car?**  
Yes, drivers need access to their own reliable vehicle, along with a valid driver’s license and insurance.  
**Where do drivers pick up the prescriptions for delivery?**  
Drivers start their shift by arriving at the local pharmacy location to pick up the packages for their assigned route.  
**Do couriers get to choose their routes?**  
Dragonfly’s dispatchers create routes based on the needs of the business and assign routes to drivers. Routes are different each day.  
**What are the routes like?**  
This job is **not** an on-demand delivery service where drivers come and go as orders are processed. Instead, couriers are assigned one-way routes that may reach as far as 65 miles from the pharmacy. Dragonfly’s dispatchers build the routes to be as efficient as possible, and drivers will deliver packages one-by-one along the route.  
**How often do drivers get paid?**  
Dragonfly couriers are paid weekly via direct deposit into a bank account. Funds are representative of all hours earned in the prior week of Sunday through Saturday.  
**Start driving today.**

title: Talent Acquisition & HR Generalist
description:
**BODYARMOR** is looking for a Talent Acquisition & HR Generalist to join our team.


This role is based in our New York City based Headquarters (in Whitestone Queens), in-office TWR only, and some travel expected. As a key contributor to BASN’s growth, you will be responsible for fostering a thriving culture, committed to EMPOWERMENT for growth. In support of the People & Culture Manager, this individual will support the collaboration with all leaders across the company to ensure the right talent, structure, culture, and processes are in place for positive and sustained impact. You will work closely with all departments to develop the strategies to empower and unleash the potential of our fantastic employees!

  

We're not just looking for an HR professional – we're searching for a fearless optimist who thrives on inspiring growth, fostering talent, and creating an environment where employees can be their authentic selves. If you’re interested in a highly-visible role, where you can leave your fingerprint and have an immediate impact on a talented and rapidly growing team—you’ve come to the right place. At BASN, we say think BIG, and Dream Bigger!!

 **RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* **Talent Acquisition:** Responsible for the end-to-end recruitment process; including sourcing, building solid pipelines, candidate assessment, interview and offer management for all BODYARMOR fulltime, part-time, contract, and internship positions.
* **People Operations:** Key support for all onboarding, transfer, and termination documentation and compliance processes ensuring all reporting, filing, and notifications are maintained and cascaded to the correct stakeholder.
* Support all things talent development and performance improvement for BASN. You will be the day-to-day “go-to” for all employees to get guidance or support related to performance completion with reporting to the People & Culture Manager. Provide administrative support for all succession planning, transformation management, and mediation documentation as needed.
* Key point of contact to support the 360 review process with all leaders across the organization. Maintain accurate documentation of all employee reviews.
* **Cultivate Engagement:** Support company-wide initiatives that spark passion, innovation, and a shared sense of purpose within the organization including internship programming, job shadow programming, and conference opportunities to support engagement for internal and prospective hires.
* **Resource and Reporting Support:** Maintain familiarity with and support BASN benefits, policies & procedures. support reporting and analytics and highly confidential information and all personnel files ensuring compliance within all HR-oriented systems i.e., Workday, Power BI tools, compensation, working hours, attrition, diversity demographics, etc. to contribute to the development of data-informed People & Culture-led strategic initiatives.
* **Organizational Charts:** Continuously maintain all organizational chart changes internally with communication to Sr. Leadership on any changes.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Bachelors degree required
* 3+ years of Human Resource experience required
* 1+ years experience within Talent Acquisition required
* Experience with Federal and State employment laws, employee relations (investigation skills), HR technical knowledge in EEO, AA, FMLA, ADA, unemployment, and worker's compensation.
* Experience in HR competences in any of the following areas (including Talent Management; Learning & Development, Relations, Recruitment/Resourcing)
* Embody the BASN values of collaboration, positivity, creativity, resilience, and belief that with hard work, nothing is out of reach.


Join us on this exciting journey to unleash the massive potential of our employees—and yourself- and elevate our brands to new heights. Apply now and DREAM BIGGER with us!

 **About Us**


BODYARMOR Sports Nutrition (BASN) is an exciting and innovative company offering premium sports and active hydration products under the powerhouse BODYARMOR and POWERADE brands. BASN is backed by one of the most iconic global brands- The Coca-Cola Company, which acquired BASN in 2021. We are driven by passion, grit, teamwork, and the vision of becoming #1 in Sports Hydration. You’ll be on the forefront of an exciting and rapidly growing industry as BASN expands its portfolio and enters new markets. We are looking for talented and passionate people who want to grow and win with us. We are committed to fostering an inclusive company culture, where diversity of thought, background and experience is celebrated and we know peak performance comes when our employees can bring their authentic selves to work. Come join team BASN for an exciting, fun and rewarding career in the dynamic world of sports and active hydration.

**What We'll Do for You**

* Provide a stimulating and supportive work environment where you can make a real impact.
* Offer opportunities for personal and professional growth within a dynamic and diverse global team.
* Ensure a competitive and comprehensive total rewards package that recognizes your contributions and supports your well-being.
* Champion a company culture that promotes work-life balance, recognizing the importance of personal time and flexibility.
* Foster a culture of recognition where your achievements are celebrated and rewarded.

  

$84,800 - $102,000

title: General Sales Manager
description:
The Manager in Training will be responsible for hiring, developing and performance managing a sales force that is focused on the guest experience, driving sales to deliver their budget and increase repeat business. By focusing on their team members “Why”, fostering positive belief systems, and coaching on process behaviors, the leader will achieve their store’s KPI’s and help each team member do the same. The Manager in Training must maintain laser focus by being in Position to Impact on the sales floor.

Essential Functions

· Lead the team by focusing on FDE’s 7 critical sales leadership processes:

1) Manage and Monitor Staffing

2) Onboard New Team Members

3) Engage, Develop and Performance Manage Team Members

4) Manage and Execute FDE’s Proven Sales Process

5) Manage Prospecting and Follow Up

6) Manage Quality and Compliance

7) Position to Impact

· Demonstrate mastery of FDE’s Leadership Toolkit.

· Attend training sessions such as Managers Meetings, Product and Vendor Training, Leadership Training and Managers Essentials to improve abilities as required.

· Coach and develop other leaders such as Assistant Selling Managers and Coaches.

· Make certain the showroom floor is guest ready at all times.

· Take Team Opportunities (T/O’s) and overflow guests to train team members and keep personal sales process skills sharp.

Schedule Expectations

· Scheduled to work a minimum of 45 hours per week including Saturdays and Sundays; the number of hours worked will increase during holidays or blackout periods, for vacation coverage, or for other business needs.

· Scheduled for two days off each week, except during holidays or blackout periods.

· Regular attendance at the assigned store in accordance with these schedule expectations is an essential function of the job and all job functions are performed at designated job location.

Education & Experience Requirements

· High school diploma or GED. Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree preferred.

· Strong ability to get results through others by effective goal setting and performance measurement.

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
**Position Title**: Registered Nurse (RN)

**Supervisor**: Chief Medical Officer

**Job Type:** Full-Time (37.5 hours weekly)

**Department**: Clinical Administration

**Schedule Shift**: Monday- Friday 9:00am-5:30pm and weekends as needed.

**FLSA**: Exempt

**Salary**: $80,000 - $90,000

Come join our amazing team of dedicated healthcare workers!

We are seeking a dedicated Registered Nurse to join our healthcare team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for providing high-quality patient care and possess a diverse skill set to excel in various medical settings.

**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN)** was founded in 1996 to ensure that the socio-economically depressed and medically underserved residents of the Bronx have access to high quality and comprehensive health care services, Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN) is a not-for-profit, community-based organization and Federally Qualified Health Center. The organization provides a wide range of comprehensive, coordinated primary medical, oral, mental health care and related diagnostic, pharmacy, social support and enabling services for medically underserved/uninsured residents. BCHN’s service area includes the entire borough of the Bronx, including all 25 zip codes.

**BCHN mission**: To improve the health of people and families in the Bronx; provide access to affordable, quality health care, especially for uninsured persons; promote disease prevention, early treatment and healthful lifestyles; and obtain financial and other resources for programs and services.

BCHN is seeking a full-time Registered Nurse who will be a key member of the health care team covering different centers, providing support to health providers in addressing the health care needs of patients. The ideal candidate will be responsible for working with other healthcare professionals to help treat patients with various injuries, illnesses, or disabilities.

**About the Role**: The Registered Nurse (RN) is responsible for providing care to patients within the center as directed by the medical staff. Their duties include communicating with doctors and other Registered Nurses about patient needs, administering immunizations and medications appropriate and using medical equipment to monitor patient’s vital signs and perform point of care testing as indicated.

Ø Observe and record patient behavior.

Ø Perform patient assessments and diagnostic tests.

Ø Collect patient health history and triage acutely ill patients.

Ø Counsel and educate patients and their families on treatment plans.

Ø Provide patient education for chronic disease self-management.

Ø Administer medication, change wound dressings, and provide self-care instruction.

Ø Read and interpret patient information, making treatment decisions when appropriate.

Ø Consult with supervisors and doctors to decide on the best treatment plan for patients.

Ø Direct and supervise nurses, medical assistants.

Ø Participate in QI projects to improve healthcare processes and improve patient outcomes.

Ø Maintains nursing competence through participation in continuing professional education and other appropriate learning experience.

Ø Works assigned shifts at locations other than primary assigned work site, when necessary, as deemed by management and in accordance with BCHN Policy.

Ø Performs other duties, as assigned.

**Qualifications and Skills**

· Experience 1-4 years as an RN

· Bachelor’s Degree (Required).

· RN License (Current New York State License Required)

· Bilingual English & Spanish (Preferred)

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:**

· Good computer skills

· Good time management and organization

· Able to analyze, review and judge different situations and take the right actions according to the situation.

· Ability to walk and stand for long periods of time; ability to lift and move patients.

· Strong communication skills. Must be able to interact well with patients, coworkers, and doctors.

Bronx Community Health Network is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender dysphoria, national origin, age, religion, disability, military, and veteran status, martial or prenatal status, citizenship status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision.

* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

description:
**About us**

Horizons In Learning is a small business in Northern NJ. Our hands-on interactive classes for elementary students promote critical thinking and exploration.

We employ instructors who are creative, intelligent ,and great at thinking on their feet in the fast paced environment of education.

Horizons In Learning is seeking instructors for our Morris and Essex County locations. This is a part-time position with work hours from 3pm to 4pm. ***We will not consider applicants who are unable to be on location promptly by 3pm.***

After School Enrichment Instructors needed for After School Program in grades K-5 classes in multiple elementary schools. We are currently hiring for classes in Morristown, Chatham, Millburn, and Short Hills.

**Classes run in fall, winter, and spring with 5, 6, or 8 week sessions.**

Instructors **MUST** be available to be on site between the hours of **3pm and 4:30pm, to be clear, you MUST be able to START at 3pm. No exceptions.**

Spring classes will begin in April.

Classes are fun and hands-on! Examples of classes include Theater Workshop, Kitchen Chemistry, Marvelous Math, etc.

Prior experience with elementary aged students is required. Teaching certification not needed.

Classes run 1 hour per day per week, but multiple classes are offered. Instructors can work 1, 2, 3, or 4 days a week.

**Must be available and able to be in Morristown, Chatham, Millburn, Short Hills starting at 3pm.**

Excellent hourly pay and a great opportunity for college students.

**Background check/fingerprints required.**

title: Compensation Manager, Global Revenue Groups
description:
At BBH we value diverse backgrounds, so if your experience looks a little different from what we've outlined and you think you can bring value to the role, we will still welcome your application!
What You Can Expect At BBH:
If you join BBH you will find a collaborative environment that enables you to step outside your role to add value wherever you can. You will have direct access to clients, information and experts across all business areas around the world. BBH will provide you with opportunities to grow your expertise, take on new challenges, and reinvent yourself—without leaving the firm. We encourage a culture of inclusion that values each employee’s unique perspective. We provide a high-quality benefits program emphasizing good health, financial security, and peace of mind. Ultimately we want you to have rewarding work with the flexibility to enjoy personal and family experiences at every career stage. Our BBH Cares program offers volunteer opportunities to give back to your community and help transform the lives of others.
Brown Brothers Harriman is currently recruiting for a Compensation Manager to join our Human Resources team. In this role you will advise on and deliver competitive, cost-effective compensation policies, programs and practices for the global Revenue business groups within Investor Services the Firm, while also managing all EU and UK remuneration directives.
This will be accomplished by providing compensation consultative guidance, analysis, support, such as funding model scenarios, bonus and salary projections, planning budgets, salary and bonus compensation planning, reconciliations, promotion programs, and delivery of market trends analysis and reporting. The role will also oversee remuneration directive compliance in our Poland, Luxembourg, Ireland and UK offices.
As a member of the Firmwide compensation team, this role leads and or participates in the delivery of Firmwide Compensation programs, processes, practices, controls, and governance in delivery of Firmwide compensation and in support of broad HR.
Some of your key responsibilities include:* Participate in ongoing review of compensation practices, policies, and processes. Lead these activities for their assigned business areas.
* Oversee location-specific regulatory compensation mandates
* Collaborate with Talent Acquisition to develop competitive compensation offers for new hires.
* Lead execution of the Total Compensation Planning cycles for assigned business areas.
* Develop compensation communications for HRBPs, managers and employees
* Execute the compensation market survey process for assigned business areas.
* Benchmark BBH jobs and practices to external market surveys
* Track key issues and trends in compensation, by participating in industry groups, conducting benchmarking studies, and gathering market intelligence from Recruiters.
* Analyze data from external and internal sources to prepare competitive intelligence summaries and compensation strategy recommendations to business leaders.
* Review new and existing job descriptions and level to appropriate grade in the BBH job hierarchy
* Act as lead and/or team member on compensation related projects such as compensation program design and implementation, external benchmarking studies, and functional promotion review.
* Lead or participate in broad HR initiatives


Must haves:* 5 + years relevant compensation experience
* Bachelor’s degree in HR, business or finance or related work experience
* Ability to manage multiple, high priority tasks and adjust to shifting priorities, while meeting deadlines
* Excellent organizational and follow up skills with a strong attention to detail
* Extensive knowledge of compensation best practices
* Ability to work independently and interact with all levels of management in a professional and positive manner.
* Strong, interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
* Pay Equity Analysis principles and methodology
* Excellent PC skills, including Microsoft Office Suite and Access


Good to have but not essential as training will be provided:* EU/UK remuneration regulatory experience is desirable
* Experience working with McLagan, Radford and KFHG surveys and databases a plus
* Job Architecture Framework development or project execution
* Experience with Workday & People fluent
* Compensation experience in the financial services industry preferred
* CCP certification (in process or achieved)


We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under federal, state or local law.  

Salary Range
$110,000-$150,000 base salary + annual bonus target*BBH’s compensation program includes base salary, discretionary bonuses, and profit-sharing. The anticipated base salary range(s) shown above are only for the indicated location(s) and may differ in other locations due to cost of living and labor considerations. Base salaries may vary based on factors such as skill, experience and qualification for the role. BBH's total rewards package recognizes your contributions with more than just a paycheck—providing you with benefits that enhance your experience at BBH from long-term savings, healthcare, and income protection to professional development opportunities and time off, our programs support your overall well-being.*

title: Account Receivable Clerk
description:
A&M Industrial is a 70-year-old, family owned, leading local industrial distribution company looking for career-oriented individuals to fill critical positions on their sales and support team.

**The A&M Way** is the fabric of our company and the essence of our value system. It guides our behaviors and practices, and defines how we relate to each other, our customers, and our business partners. This is who we are, the culture that drives our performance and extraordinary success.

The **Accounts Receivable Analyst** will collect payments from past due accounts - with excellent customer/client focused skills, problem solving, thoroughness, MS Office skills and self-motivation.

***Essential Duties and Responsibilities:*** 

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Majority of the work will be on telephone and via email.
* Proactively research and solve payment discrepancies.
* Obtain accurate information if needed from research, accounting manager.
* Contact customer/clients in a professional manner regarding past due accounts for payment and process payment to ensure ongoing customer/client satisfaction.
* Manage inquires for payments and proof of deliveries and follow up in an organized and timely manner.
* Manage time effectively, meet personal goals and work effectively with other members of the team.
* Maintain proficiency in using computers, data entry terminal and other common office equipment and software.
* Follow company policies and procedures.
* Present a professional image at all times.
* Extremely well organized and excellent at following up.
* Interface between different departments of the company.

Requirements

***Qualifications:***

* High School diploma required.
* Associate or bachelor’s in accounting preferred.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related software as well as other accounting software programs.
* Experience with Eclipse system is a plus.
* Ability to operate related office equipment, such as computers, calculator, and copier.
* Ability to work independently and in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to anticipate work needs and interact professionally with customers.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

***Work Environment:***

This job operates in person, in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, document scanners, filing cabinets and fax machines.

***Physical demands:***

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This is a largely sedentary role; however, the majority of the day will be spent on the telephone, computer and some filing is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary. Individuals may need to sit or stand as needed. This position may require walking primarily on a level surface for periods of time as well as reaching above shoulder heights or below the waist or lifting as required to file documents or store materials throughout the workday. Proper lifting techniques are required. This position may occasionally lift up to 25 pounds.

***Position type/expected hours of work:***

This is a full-time position. Hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 am – 5:00 pm; with a 60 minute unpaid lunch. 40 hours per week. This position is eligible for benefits available to all full time employees, including participation in health/dental/vision/group life/long-term-disability insurance plans, 401k, paid holidays and vacation

***Travel***

No travel is expected for this position. Job will be in Rahway, NJ and in person.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

***A&M INDUSTRIAL, INC. is committed to equal employment opportunity.*** ***We will not discriminate against employee or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis including, but not limited to veteran status, citizenship status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, creed,*** ***ancestry,*** ***marital status, domestic partnership or civil union status, gender identity or expression, affections or sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic testing and information,*** ***atypical hereditary cellular or blood trait, or any other factor prohibited by law.***

**Do Not Call About The Job!!**

title: Nurse Practitioner
description:
Join our dynamic emergency medicine team in The Bronx, NY, where physician assistants and nurse practitioners are pivotal in **delivering exceptional care**. We're a close-knit group from diverse backgrounds across the Tri-state Area, dedicated to a high-acuity, low-volume setting in **New York's first free-standing emergency department**. Enjoy autonomy in medical decision-making with **flexible scheduling** to balance personal and professional priorities. The Bronx's rich cultural diversity and vibrant community make it an appealing place for career advancement and personal fulfillment.

**People**

* We are a closely-knit, established team of physicians with strong PA leadership.
* Our group comes from various areas in the Tri-state Area -NYC, NJ, and Hudson Valley.
* I am involved in all medical staff meetings and committees.

**Practice**

* Thrive in New York’s first free-standing emergency department.
* Cater to a diverse patient population with a low-volume ED with high acuity directly, providing a dynamic and challenging work environment.
* Single physician coverage ensures a focused and independent approach to medical decision-making and treatment provision.
* We maintain strong connections through team meetings bi-monthly.
* Recognizing the importance of family and spending time outdoors, we offer a flexible schedule. We’re always there to support each other when covering shifts.
* The expected annual compensation for this role is between $115k – $144k, depending upon experience.
* Benefits include medical, dental, vision, life, and AD&D insurance, long- and short-term disability, 401k with match, paid medical malpractice and tail coverage, and annual CME allowance.

**Purpose**

* We put patients first. Always.
* A focus on growth and development is a key feature of Sound, where teammates can expand their careers here locally and within the broader medical group.
* We’re a community-minded team and encourage our team members who want to contribute in and out of the hospital to help make our local community thrive.

The Bronx offers rich cultural diversity, vibrant neighborhoods, and access to beautiful parks like the Bronx Zoo and the New York Botanical Garden, making it an appealing place to live for many.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $115,000.00 - $144,000.00 per year

* Emergency Medicine
